Reponse: Lance feels laughter bubble up in his stomach. Shit, he hates this, they're hilarious, what the hell. He's so tired, he can't even allow himself to laugh. "How long have you guys been sitting here for?"
title: skin hunger
author: hiuythn

Dialogue: Lance feels laughter bubble up in his stomach. Shit, he hates this, they're hilarious, what the hell. He's so tired, he can't even allow himself to laugh. "How long have you guys been sitting here for?"
Reponse: "All day, asshole," replies Pidge. "Don't get poisoned next time, Jesus Christ."
title: skin hunger
author: hiuythn

Dialogue: "All day, asshole," replies Pidge. "Don't get poisoned next time, Jesus Christ."
Reponse: "Shiro, you got any threes?" he asks.
title: skin hunger
author: hiuythn

Dialogue: "Shiro, you got any threes?" he asks.
Reponse: "Fuck all of you!" Shiro hurls his cards at them.
title: skin hunger
author: hiuythn

Dialogue: Keith peeks up from behind his arms and shares a smile with him. "Feel alright?"
Reponse: "Same as always," he answers. "Sorry I didn't notice."
title: skin hunger
author: hiuythn

Dialogue: "Same as always," he answers. "Sorry I didn't notice."
Reponse: "It's alright, we've learned to expect that from you."
title: skin hunger
author: hiuythn

Dialogue: "It's alright, we've learned to expect that from you."
Reponse: Lance smacks his arm weakly. "Ass."
title: skin hunger
author: hiuythn

Dialogue: "Idiot."
Reponse: "Oh," breathes Lance. "It's over?"
title: skin hunger
author: hiuythn

Dialogue: "Mhm. Found out when you fell on me. Didn't feel that stupid urge to..." Keith trails off, face reddening.
Reponse: Lance clears his throat. "That's--um, good?"
title: skin hunger
author: hiuythn

Dialogue: "This is nice," Keith hums, rubbing a thumb over the back of Lance's hand. He hasn't let go. Why hasn't he let go yet?
Reponse: Lance raises a brow. "Would've thought you'd gotten used to it. That's all we did for months."
title: skin hunger
author: hiuythn

Dialogue: "...Yeah."
Reponse: "I'm not reading you wrong?" he asks, just--just to be sure. Just in case.
title: skin hunger
author: hiuythn

Dialogue: "Do you want me to say it?"
Reponse: "I wouldn't mind."
title: skin hunger
author: hiuythn

Dialogue: "Dude, are you even listening to me?" Scott whines. He taps on the Jeep to get Stiles' attention.
Reponse: "Did you just see that? Derek laughed. And smiled. And I think he made a joke." Stiles opens up his driver's door and leans over to unlock Scott's door. Stiles isn't sure why he locks the doors to his Jeep. The truth is that his dad, the Sheriff, had drilled a personal book called, How to Be Safe, into his head. Nothing interesting ever happens in Beacon Hills, so Stiles isn't sure why he feels compelled to listen.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "I'm sure that you have more private places to fuck."
Reponse: Stiles blinks three to maybe a thousand times before he realizes just what exactly Derek Hale had said to him. He snorts, and that turns into a full laugh. Clapping a hand on Derek's shoulder, and bending forward, he wheezes, "Holy shit that was priceless. Your face. I bet you do excellent at poker."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Only thirteen thousand times, Scott. Shut up."
Reponse: Coach gets everyone's attention with a quick yell. Stiles notices Isaac jump. Coach points a finger at Scott. "McCall, I hear that our big game move depends on you. Christ almighty, don't fuck it up or you'll be joining Bilinski on the bench permanently for next year too. God forbid you become another Greenberg. I already have one of those, and--oh, Greenberg, shut up."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "He's giving me more responsibility."
Reponse: "So he's feeling lazy."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "I have..." Isaac hesitates. Stiles wonders if he was going to say he has to go home. But Isaac nods. "Thanks."
Reponse: "Great!"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Bilinski, I hear that you convinced Hale to take everyone out for a celebration," Coach says, or shouts, when Stiles walks into the locker room. A few cheers of excitement from the team occur, and Stiles just shrugs. Coach smiles. "Good, I like that my bench warmers are wanting to bond with my team. But do not take them out to get wasted, you hear?"
Reponse: "Loud and clear, Coach."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Loud and clear, Coach."
Reponse: "These guys better be ready for tomorrow's practice."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: When Stiles enters the arcade, he finds an empty seat beside Lydia Martin. He slips into it, happy to see Scott sit across the table with Allison and Isaac. "Hey beautiful."
Reponse: "Ugh, Stiles, stop that." Lydia's eyes sparkle. She leans forward and whispers, "A little birdy told me that this celebration was your idea."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Ugh, Stiles, stop that." Lydia's eyes sparkle. She leans forward and whispers, "A little birdy told me that this celebration was your idea."
Reponse: "Not quite. I just mentioned team bonding time," Stiles whispers back. He glances around, surprised that he doesn't see Derek. He then focuses all his attention on Lydia.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Derek seems to stiffen, but he continues to play. When he doesn't say anything, Stiles wonders if he's managed to hurt Derek's feelings. He'd meant it as a joke, light and easy, to see if he could get Derek to admit to drugs. He's not sure why he thought that it'd work. Derek doesn't really talk to people. After the silence drags out, Stiles says, "Dude, I'm sorry. I wasn't trying to insult you. I'm just saying, you can run."
Reponse: Derek just nods, and continues to hit the puck back. They'd fallen into a silent game of passing it back and forth, without the challenge of trying to win. After a moment, Derek says, "Running fast has just been a natural ability."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "I'm not some skinny, defenceless kid."
Reponse: "You're definitely not a kid," Stiles murmurs. The puck slides back to Derek. He glances up, to see surprise on Derek's face, and the puck clangs into his net. He smirks. "Is that how I beat you? Just shock you with words. Because I can be quite good at that. I mean, if that's what it takes to win...all's fair in love and war, right?"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Derek tilts his head, before hitting the puck a little harder this time. "We do what most do. We talk, eat, and play video games. Sometimes come here."
Reponse: "Isaac too?" Stiles asks.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Derek stabs the page with his finger. Stiles leans forward and it takes him a minute to read his own writing. "Oh! That says that Isaac doesn't do well with people running towards him fast, but he's pretty great at being an attacker. And Boyd favours his right hand on the stick a little too far up. It should be one-third of the way up the stick handle, not half, which is usually what he does. And then--"
Reponse: "I'll keep reading," Derek interrupts. Stiles leans back, enjoying the view of Derek reading intensely. He sips some of his coffee, and wonders what Derek thinks of him. So far Stiles hasn't made the best impression, at least not when it comes to Derek. Not that Stiles cares or anything, of course. Derek Hale doesn't like most people.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Stiles grins. "It's a play I designed. Someone else has probably used it before, but it should solve the Isaac, Boyd, Scott, and Jackson problem. If we follow this, it'll play up everyone's strengths. Basically, you'll be playing a sneaky wolf who circles around here--" Stiles points to the diagram, "--and then Boyd can throw it to you when you get here. That's where Isaac comes in. And then right here, it'll be Danny. He's pretty solid overall, not seriously excelling in any skill over the others, so he's a safe person to put there. Then you'll move here, and then score there."
Reponse: Derek looks up at Stiles, without tipping his head up too far. "You said you thought the Scott thing would be a one-time thing."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Stiles snorts loudly, before he casually sips on his coffee. When he realizes that Derek seems a little worried, Stiles reassures him. "Dude, you don't have any weaknesses. Except when you slow down after you run too fast. Just keep running. No one will catch up to you anyway. That's why you have a direct line here."
Reponse: Derek nods. He doesn't look down at the paper. He just studies Stiles' face, and it makes Stiles wonder if Derek really is on steroids. Maybe that's why he looks a little upset for not having any weaknesses. Stiles flips the page, and then points at DAMMIT GREENBERG. "We need to try this one. If only to see Coach's face when Greenberg trips and knocks over two of the opponent's players."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Derek's eyebrows are ridiculously expressive, and Stiles is learning how to read them lately. He looks concerned--just as he had when he'd been warning Stiles out in the woods--and then he shakes his head in the smallest of movements. "I'm not sure that's a good idea."
Reponse: "It'll keep Isaac out of his house, just for a bit longer."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Stiles doesn't think, he just reaches out and places a hand on Derek's arm. It makes Derek slowly drop his arms to the table, but Stiles keeps on touching him. "Derek, it's not your fault. Until Isaac is ready to talk about it, you can't prove anything, and you can't do anything. Trust me; my dad's tried everything he can think of. Maybe...maybe this will help Isaac realize that he needs help."
Reponse: Derek shakes his head. "I've offered to have him come live with my family, but he swears his dad would just drag him home. I've seen his dad pull up when he comes to get Isaac and yell. It's not like an angry parent, it's an..."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Stiles rolls his eyes, but he finds himself smiling a little. "Dude, relax. We can work out the kinks of these plays now. We have two more practices until the game on Saturday. It'll be fine. They went well on Sunday at practice, didn't they?"
Reponse: "Yeah, I guess," Derek mutters. "Okay, fine. Split the team."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: They do it again, with Stiles nervously standing on the edge of the field. He shouts, "Jackson, when you catch, pull your left arm in just a little more!"
Reponse: Jackson shoots him a glare, but Stiles watches him tuck his left arm in just a smidgen more than usual, and the catch is flawless. Stiles jumps up with a cheer. He turns to Coach. "Did you see that? Jackson didn't fumble to keep the ball in his net at all."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Stiles sits Isaac down on the closed toilet lid, and then starts to pull out the First Aid kit. He starts chatting. "I'm an expert when it comes to the First Aid stuff. I didn't need to study for my certification because I've been dealing with it ever since I was a kid. I'm always tripping over something, or walking into things. So we'll have you looking good as new. Except...Isaac, I'm so sorry dude, I'm going to have to take photos as evidence. And I know this is probably really awful for you, because we're not even really friends-friends, but dude, I'm the Sheriff's kid. I know how to keep quiet about stuff like this, so you won't have to worry about it getting out or anything. But are you gonna be comfortable with me taking pictures?"
Reponse: "Do whatever, Stiles." Isaac looks worried for a minute before nodding. "Thanks."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Thank you."
Reponse: Isaac lifts the book questioningly. "The Adventures of Robin Hood? Really?"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "It's a good story. In case you can't sleep." Stiles shrugs. He sets the other stuff onto the bed. "Towels are here. Feel free to use whatever's in the shower. Also, the food in the kitchen is all yours. And the Twinkies in my room are off-limits unless you ask real nice."
Reponse: "Stiles, I can't accept--"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Stiles, I can't accept--"
Reponse: "You can and you will. The wifi password is written on that notepad there. I noticed you brought your laptop and school work. But no lacrosse uniform or change of clothes. Don't go back to your house. Use my stuff for now. I'll get Coach to get you another uniform--say that I accidentally ruined yours; he'll totally buy it because it's me. When you're ready, I'll go back to your place with you and we can move your stuff over." Stiles sits down beside Isaac on the bed. "You know, this is so weird for me. If anyone had told me a week ago that you'd be in my guest room now, I wouldn't have believed them. Strange things keep happening to me--the whole assistant coach thing, for one--but I'm glad for this one. I'm glad...that you're going to get out."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Really?" Isaac looks thoughtful. "Yeah, I guess I could tell Scott."
Reponse: "And Derek. You should probably tell Derek. I know it's not obvious, but he does care. I think." Stiles shrugs. "I won't tell anyone, but maybe you want to. Derek will just--"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "And Derek. You should probably tell Derek. I know it's not obvious, but he does care. I think." Stiles shrugs. "I won't tell anyone, but maybe you want to. Derek will just--"
Reponse: "--want to adopt me and never let me leave the house in fear that someone else will hurt me. I know. I don't want him to know. He'll go into super protective mode." Isaac lets out the smallest laugh. Stiles almost misses it. "He's been pretty vocal about the whole situation. His family will freak if they find out, and smother me. Boyd too. Erica the most, actually. She's probably the scariest person I've ever met."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Stop thanking me. God, Lahey. Just promise me that you'll fight to make your dad pay for this. That you won't give up or go back."
Reponse: "Promise. I won't go back."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Promise. I won't go back."
Reponse: "Did Isaac ask you to pick him up?" his dad asks after Stiles explains that he just went to get Isaac.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Back at you, son. Get some sleep. I love you."
Reponse: "Love you too," Stiles says. He heads to the door, stepping outside into the fresh air.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Hey buddy. Thanks for letting me know something was wrong. I think Isaac will be alright. He's going to press charges. Tomorrow. That's all for tomorrow." Stiles lets out a shaky breath. "God, how the hell did you know?"
Reponse: "Derek Hale would kill me right now. He's irrationally afraid of wolves. God, if only he could see me know. I'm positive he'd grab me by my ear and drag me away to give me the longest lecture." Stiles chuckles lightly at the thought. He looks down at the wolf. "I'm the craziest person on this planet right now, but I'm so exhausted that I can't be bothered to care."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Yeah, sure, okay." Isaac nods. He looks down at his cereal. Then he asks, "Think Scott would come with us?"
Reponse: "In a heartbeat. Want me to call him?"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "No, I'm not ready for Derek yet. With Derek comes Erica and Boyd, and probably the Hales." Isaac shakes his head. "Too intimidating. Plus, I couldn't live with them. They'd drive me mad."
Reponse: Stiles lets out a small laugh. "I bet. The Hales seem pretty intense."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Is there a system?" Danny asks, grinning. "To decide who's worth jerking off to?"
Reponse: "No, but there should be. Sometimes people pop into your head that you do not want there and it ruins the mood," Stiles deadpans. Laughter ensues. Stiles adds, "I think it'll be nice having someone around the house. When my dad's on nights, the house gets a little lonely."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "I came up with a new play last night."
Reponse: "What if we put you there?" Derek asks, pointing to where Scott would have been.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Stiles thinks back to the yellow eyes. "Nawh, I think I scare him."
Reponse: "Huh. Why do you say that?"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Uh, long story." Stiles is sure that Derek wouldn't want him talking about how weird he'd gotten. "Will you see him tonight?"
Reponse: "No," Erica's voice comes as she walks up to Boyd. She leans on her tiptoes to give him a long, and rather interesting, kiss. When she pulls away, she says, "It's date night tonight, Stilinski. Are you coming to my party tomorrow?"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Amazing, heavenly, wonderful, holy shit why don't you open a bakery good. This. Pie, I mean. This pie." Stiles feels his cheeks reddening. Derek's going to think he's an idiot.
Reponse: "I applied to baking school, actually," Derek tells him.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "It's fine, really, but I told Erica and Boyd I'd go with a date. They're having that small dinner beforehand. It's probably better this way." Cora looks at Stiles. "Our mother's a bit protective of us still, and doesn't think we should bother dating in high school. She's old-fashion that way."
Reponse: "Sucks," Stiles says because he has absolutely no idea what else to say.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Are you free tomorrow?" Cora asks, her eyes lighting up.
Reponse: "I'm sure Stiles is busy," Derek suggests.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Yes, ma'am."
Reponse: "He's a good man," she comments, but her eyes narrow on her son. "I wasn't expecting company."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: He gives them all a wave and rushes towards the door. Dammit, he has to put his shoes on. He bends down to do so, when he hears Derek's voice low and near him, "I'm sorry. It's just a little complicated around here sometimes."
Reponse: Stiles straightens when he has both shoes on. "Dude, I get it. I don't want you to get in trouble with your mom or anything though, so blame it all on me. I'm the Sheriff's kid. No one stays mad long."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Isaac shrugs in the darkness. "I actually don't know. It's weird. Once she found out that I was only a friend, she totally lightened up around me. Talia might be the scariest woman I've ever met. Did you meet her tonight?"
Reponse: "Yeah, and let me tell you, being the Sheriff's son didn't work on her. She seemed to hate me more." Stiles frowns. "It must suck to be them. Is it because of Kate?"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Stiles thinks about the flash of Derek's yellow eyes, and then frowns. He'd always known Derek is different. Lydia had tried to convince him that he was romanticizing Derek, because Stiles wanted Derek to be different, but he knows otherwise. Stiles frowns into the darkness. Finally, he settles on, "I don't think Derek's into me. Besides, there's no risk if I obsess about him from afar."
Reponse: "Stiles," Isaac says, exasperated. "Derek talks about you too, you know."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Scott finally told you?" Isaac asks, his voice low.
Reponse: It's Stiles' turn to freeze. "Uh, no, actually, he didn't. I just assumed and I guess I was right?"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Lydia spins around, eyeing him carefully. He can see the wheels turning. She nods. "That's interesting. She must think you're a bad date."
Reponse: Stiles laughs, and says, "Lyds, it makes sense. Erica's house is so close to my place, and the Hales live out in the middle of fuck all."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Isaac!" Stiles yells down the hall.
Reponse: "Yeah buddy?"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "You can leave them here, if you want." Derek eyes Stiles before turning the car off. "I won't be drinking."
Reponse: "Oh fuck, I forgot my booze. I am an awful party-goer." Stiles smacks the side of his head, and it seems to draw a smile from Derek.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Stiles, this is a mature dinner. No messing around," Erica says. They walk into her backyard. Stiles admits Erica puts on a party just like Lydia Martin. There are Christmas lights hanging around the backyard to light it up, and it looks gorgeous on the deck. There are decorations here and there, and other sources of lighting. The truth is that Stiles is a little surprised that Erica would go out of her way to make the party look so nice.
Reponse: "Wow, Reyes, you went all out."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: She holds up a bottle of wine. "Oh yeah."
Reponse: "Looks good," Stiles says, smiling and giving Lydia and Aiden a small wave. He settles into a seat, and Derek sits down beside him.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Oh no, you don't," Erica says, pointing her finger at Derek. Stiles watches with a muffled laugh as she goes into Scary Erica mode. "You're not leaving, Derek. We're going to have a nice meal and--"
Reponse: When Erica starts to clear the table, Stiles jumps up. "No, no, sit. This is your party. Derek and I will do the dishes."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Derek doesn't argue. He might let out a small growl, but Stiles chooses to count it as a win when Derek starts helping him clear up the table. They go into the kitchen to do the dishes, and Stiles speaks in a low voice. "Derek, what's going on with you tonight?"
Reponse: "Nothing. Really," Derek says. "Leave it alone, Stiles."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Derek nods. "Yeah, of course, but why do you smell different?"
Reponse: If Stiles is fazed by the question, he doesn't show it, and shrugs. "I don't know. I showered."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "He wasn't talking about it with you, Derek. It's not your fault you couldn't do anything," Stiles reminds him. He stops at Derek's car and opens the back door to grab his pie. He gives Derek a small grin that fades when the door shuts and he goes back to the topic. "Isaac told me that he knows how protective you would've gotten, and that's not what he wanted or needed."
Reponse: "I could've given him space," Derek growls.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "How did I not know that?" Derek whispers.
Reponse: "It wasn't your secret to know," Stiles replies. He can see the pure hurt and horror on Derek's face though, and reaches out. This time Derek doesn't step away, and Stiles puts his hand on Derek's forearm. This is not the time to be thinking about how good and hot Derek feels. "Look, Isaac can never ever find out that I told you. I just...you need to understand him a bit more. I can see the guilt and confusion on your face whenever you see him. I saw you at the station. You care, and you're hurt because he didn't come to you."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: He pulls the pies out, grabs two forks, and hands one to Derek who seems surprised. "Stiles, the pies are yours."
Reponse: "Yeah, I know but friends share. God, Hale, didn't your mother teach you any manners at all?" Stiles grins, and stabs a fork into the pumpkin pie. He savours the bite, making sure to lick the fork afterwards, and then moans. "God, the things your pie does to me."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "I won't," Derek tells him honestly. "I bake other things. Pies are a speciality, but my cupcakes are pretty good too."
Reponse: "Cookies?"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Perfect," Isaac says. He glances at Stiles. "Keys?"
Reponse: "Right, yeah, sure. Why do you want to do lunch with Derek?" Stiles asks before he throws Isaac the keys.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Isaac raises an eyebrow at Stiles. "Talk about me, you two?"
Reponse: "Only like all the time," Stiles says dramatically. He leans forward on the island. "I mean, god, how can we resist you, Lahey? Look at your gorgeous hair. It makes me want to run my hands through it all night long if you catch my drift."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Ha! It's so fucking weird but it, like, works, y'know!" Scott pokes Stiles' in the chest harder than he probably meant to. "What about you and Derek?"
Reponse: Stiles snorts. "Dude, dude, dude. Derek so does not want up on all this." Stiles motions to himself. "He's totally not into me. Which is fineee, you know, because like I have to...I just...god, his ass. I might pull a Scott and write poetry about it!"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "I don't know what it is about Derek. I've talked about his ass a lot to Lydia. I think she thinks my obsession is just about his looks," Stiles admits.
Reponse: "It definitely isn't. You like the whole package, or none of it," Scott says. He looks at Isaac. "He's always been really good at seeing someone's faults, and accepting them if their strengths and personality outweighs them."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Stiles rolls his eyes. "Whatever. The point is, that was the first time we talked, so I can't even tell you anything about before, when I was younger. It's not like we've ever had a moment. In fact, I'm positive that Derek's only ever seen me as this annoying kid who shows up randomly."
Reponse: Scott's face lights up. "Oh my god, I remember how you obsessed over the whole Kate thing when it happened. I didn't realize it was because you had a crush. I thought you were kind of into Kate or something, and disappointed, because you talked to her that one time in the hallway a few weeks before it happened!"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Never. I'm a man," Isaac says. His face softens a little though, and he says, "I do, I guess."
Reponse: "Wow, how romantic," Stiles smirks. When Scott enters the living room again, he says, "You've got yourself one true romantic here."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Stiles tries to smile, but he can tell it doesn't quite make it. His nerves are too busy making him stare at Derek as though they've never met before. He shakes his head, before opening the door. "Hey! Hi, yeah, uh, c'mon in. Isaac and Scott just went upstairs. They're looking for an old board game in the attic. Scott suggested it 'cause it's...innocent enough, and if you go home and tell your mom we just played board games, well, she can't really hate me for that, right?"
Reponse: Derek glances back at him, an apologetic expression on his face. "That...that's thoughtful. So. They know that my mom hasn't exactly been, uh, supportive of our, um, friendship?"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "No biggie," Stiles responds.
Reponse: "Wrong." Derek studies Stiles. "I...well, I appreciate that."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Stiles laughs. "Sorry man, but this is war."
Reponse: "Another kid!" Stiles says, triumphantly. He high-fives Derek. They now have four kids, whereas Isaac and Scott have one. "Is it a boy or a girl, baby?"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Stiles bursts into laughter. "You wouldn't be birthing her. Firstly, you're a male and guys don't get knocked up. Secondly, you are the proud father of Boyd, Erica, and Danny, but you balk at being a father-figure to your own sister? Let's just say that we adopted her."
Reponse: Derek rolls his eyes. "That's nice. Okay, sure, we can adopt my sister. My parents have gone to South Africa and she doesn't want to go with them, so we become her legal guardians."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "It's fine, we had fun." Stiles tugs off his sweater, and Cora takes it without hesitating. Stiles makes a face and Cora waves her hand for him to take off his shirt too.
Reponse: "Why didn't she take your boxers?" Derek demands. "You'll never be comfortable. Follow me, I'll show you to the bathroom and you can...change. I brought you a pair of my boxers, I hope that's okay."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Derek nods. "Me too. He's been my best friend for years, and I just...I couldn't get him out."
Reponse: "How many times do I have to tell you that it's not your fault?" Stiles immediately asks.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: He sounds sincerely interested. Stiles lays back on Derek's bed, and tries to think of a topic. He settles with, "I saw a wolf in the woods a few weeks ago."
Reponse: Derek's interest is clear. "What?"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Already? Dude, that's awesome. Congratulations!" Stiles gives him a lazy grin. He's honestly happy for Derek, really, but oh my god, the thought of him leaving Beacon Hills scares him. Stiles is getting used to having Derek around, and oh god, if Derek leaves, Stiles is going to be seriously upset. Not that he has any right to be.
Reponse: Derek looks bashful. "Thanks. I just...it's so weird. They're all great schools. I'm considering going to Sacramento."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Let it go, Hale. I'm not afraid of the woods. I figured I could beat today's thunderstorm though."
Reponse: "Clearly not," Derek deadpans. Stiles lets out a laugh.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Derek shrugs, still smiling. "It was endearing, Stiles. Nothing to be embarrassed about. I appreciate it."
Reponse: "Ugh, no wonder your ego is in fucking space."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "I'm glad me being a dog is funny to you," Stiles retorts. But god, the smile on Derek's face might keep Stiles from never, ever feeling sad ever, ever again. How is it that a man could be that sinfully beautiful? Stiles feels like he shouldn't be allowed to be that beautiful. It doesn't matter, because he is, and Stiles is going to memorize it. What if he doesn't know Derek in ten years? He wants to be able to recall with every single fucking detail how Derek smiles, because Stiles is positive his crush on Derek won't disappear in ten years. He's not sure it ever will.
Reponse: "So you'd be a regular at my bakery?" Derek asks, sounding a little nervous.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "So you'd be a regular at my bakery?" Derek asks, sounding a little nervous.
Reponse: Stiles nods. "If what you bake is anything near as good as your pies from the other day, then hell fucking yes. I would even become a partner--granted, if I could afford it--because your pies were that good."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Derek seems to tense a little, but then he relaxes. "You protect Isaac by sleeping with him and scaring away all the boogie men."
Reponse: Stiles lets out a soft laugh. "Yeah, you could say that, I guess. Sometimes when Scott sleeps over, I wake up to him drooling on my neck. So this isn't unusual for me."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "How could you not tell me?" she hisses when she gets close to him. Erica puts a hand on his arm and shoves him back against the lockers. "Oh my god, Stilinski. Jackson texted me saying you showed up with Derek today."
Reponse: "He's the biggest gossip," Stiles mutters.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: She studies him with her lips pressed tight. When she speaks again, her tone is softer. "You and Derek are two of the few good things I have in my life. I will support you both, but next time, I don't want to hear from Jackson that you two showed up together, with you wearing Derek's letterman jacket, okay?"
Reponse: Stiles' annoyance evaporates. He nods. "Don't worry, Erica. I won't let Jackson know anything before you. I don't have my phone--so I couldn't text you."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "And Jackson?" he asks.
Reponse: She shrugs. "Jackson proved he doesn't care about me, because he went and screwed that stupid librarian helper."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Derek smiles. "Good. We'll try dinner with my family sometime soon, though?"
Reponse: "How about tomorrow night?" Stiles suggests.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "You could get him back in a heartbeat, if that's what you really want," Stiles tells her in his best Scott-like voice. He tilts his head. "Do you want him back?"
Reponse: She shrugs. "I...god, I actually miss him so much. I mean, I guess I thought that he would fight for me, or something. And he just let me go. Just like that. I've watched him at lunch when we're with Aiden. He doesn't even look upset!"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Lydia clings onto Stiles' arm, burying her face into his sleeve, and cries softly. She leans into his chest, just slightly, and Stiles strokes her hair. "Lydia, it's going to be okay, I promise you."
Reponse: "It's so stupid. I left him, but I'm the one who's broken up about it!" she says, gasping slightly to catch a breath. She lifts her head. Their eyes meet. Then she glances down to his lips.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Thanks, Talia. And oh, that's okay. It might make it easier for us to get to know each other a bit better. Um." Stiles doesn't know what else to say.
Reponse: She pulls the door open wider, so he can come in. He quickly takes off his shoes and before he can ask about Derek, the guy appears at the bottom of the stairs. He's eyeing his mother, and shooting Stiles a concerned look. "Hey Stiles!"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Thanks for having me over," Stiles says for the fourteenth time.
Reponse: "It was our pleasure," Talia tells him. She's smiling at him genuinely now, and he feels as though he's going to burst with excitement. Dinner and dessert had gone very well. Of course, he's not sure that he's been accepted as Derek's friend, but he'd made his mother smile about eight times in the past hour and a half. Stiles is pretty sure that's a win, considering how hard it is to get the Hales to smile. She adds, "You're welcome here anytime, as Derek's friend. Do you understand me?"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: A few seconds later, Derek rushes in. "Hey, sorry, went to the washroom."
Reponse: "It's fine," Stiles says.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "It's fine," Stiles says.
Reponse: "My mother--"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: This is too important for him to mess it up, so Stiles straightens his shoulders and drops his voice. "I won't be at practice today. Coach knows why. But I need you to skip it too. Meet me in the woods."
Reponse: Derek draws his eyebrows together, tilts his head. "Uh."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Scott and Isaac are both madly in love with this girl named Allison. Can you believe that Scott finally got the girl? And guy. They're in this strange little threesome relationship, but it works well for them. Allison's great. She's really supportive and funny. I don't mind when the three of them are hanging around the house. They're not all relationshipy around me, so it's fine."
Reponse: "Oh man, but I wish you were here to meet Erica Reyes. I know you probably remember her from when she was a kid. But damn, Mom. She's all grown up now. She's a hell raiser. You would love her. She's all kinds of badass. She's a little sassy too, but mainly she has a huge heart. I like that she loves me. It's almost as if it's an honour to be loved by her."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Boyd likes me. He asked me to be in his hypothetical wedding party. Isn't that sweet? He's got a heart of gold, Mom. I'm glad he likes me. Derek told me he does, anyway."
Reponse: "Oh god, Derek. Mom, I don't even know how to describe how I feel about Derek. You know when I used to come here and tell you about my obsession revolving him? Well, we're friends now, you know. His mom's warming up to me. It's pretty nice. I do dinners there every other Thursday. We're trying to not push our luck. Talia told me that she really liked you. I don't see why she wouldn't. I had no idea that you knew Derek. I'm glad you met him. I'm so glad you met him. Isn't he wonderful, Mom? He's grown up to be quite the man. I'm proud to know him."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Aw, Mom, you would be so happy for me right now. I'm kind of coming together, y'know?" He pauses. "Oh! Oh my god, how could I forget this? Coach...Coach gave me your medal. He said that when you gave it to him, you said you wanted him to have your proudest moment. He gave it to me because he thinks I'd be your...I'd be your proudest moment."
Reponse: The tears fall. He can't hold them back anymore. "Mom, oh god, Mom. It broke my heart. It also makes me want to be someone you can be very proud of. It's kind of awesome that I can tell you that I'm officially the Assistant Coach! Jackson calls me Ass Coach, but it's funny so I don't mind. Coach Finstock lets me do all the coaching now...he says he wants to let me shine. It's fu--fucking cool. Oh, sorry, I, uh, well, you know, I swear now. I'm old enough to swear."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Mom, I really, really miss you. I'm okay. I'm doing okay. I'm happy, even. But I really miss you. Dad misses you too. He doesn't talk about you much, but that's not new. I think it hurts him to think about how you're no longer with us. I get it. I do. But god, it's so fucking nice to talk about you, to remember you...I talk about you with Derek. He always listens."
Reponse: "I don't know how to say this, but Mom, I love him so much and I'm scared that I might lose him. I don't know what I'll do if I lose him. I lost you and it drove me crazy. I think part of my obsession with Derek stemmed on handling your loss badly. It's not why I love him though. There are too many reasons to name. He's going to come to the woods today, because I told him that...it's your anniversary. He'll be there for me."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Derek breaks the silence with a small whisper. "When did you figure it out?"
Reponse: Stiles glances at him. "The first time I met you."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "You threw me off at how surprised you seemed when I showed up at your house during the storm," Stiles says.
Reponse: Derek raises an eyebrow--it's a familiar expression both his human and wolf selves wear often. "Don't you think it would've been more suspicious if I had just accepted you were at my house randomly?"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Your wolf stuff that I'd already told you?" Stiles finishes. "Well, I could turn that around and say that you always acted as though I didn't have a clue it was you."
Reponse: "I couldn't be that obvious," Derek mumbles. "If I had already known, or acted as though I knew, something that you only told a wolf, don't you think you would've figured it out sooner?"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "I've wanted it longer."
Reponse: "Bull shit," Derek whispers. "I had to quit the swimming team because I couldn't handle you. We were so young, but my wolf just wanted you so badly. My mom forced me to quit."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Stiles snorts. "Derek, they'll find out eventually, because I figured it out months ago. If some of them haven't figured it out already, they will. They're not the kind of people who would abandon you, leave, or think you're monsters, okay. And it might be nice if you explain to Allison why her sister is locked up."
Reponse: Derek's closes his eyes. "I wanted to, you know."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Scott excitedly says to Stiles, "I told you that the New and Improved Scott McCall plan would work out in everyone's favour, dude."
Reponse: "So you guys are okay with this news?" Stiles asks.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Jackson stands up, stretches, and then says, "Congrats on finally getting laid, Stilinski. It took you long enough."
Reponse: "Thanks, Jackson." Stiles looks up at Derek and shakes his head. Friends like theirs don't come around every day. He's grateful for that. He wants to keep them all to himself.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "No, we're doing a double date on Friday. You and Boyd should join us," Stiles says, smiling. He shuts his locker door to walk with her towards hers. "Cora hasn't told her girlfriend yet."
Reponse: "I know," Erica says, nodding. "Boyd and I will totally crash your date though. Can we not do Joe's Pizza?"
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "You two are perfect for one another," Stiles assures her. "Derek and I want to be like that."
Reponse: "I think you couldn't find two more deserving idiots to be in love with each other if you searched the whole damn world for centuries," Erica says. Her eyes soften. "C'mon, our boyfriends are probably waiting to drive us home."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: Stiles tosses an arm around her. "I'm happy for all of us."
Reponse: "Glad to see you two shits finally got your acts together," Coach shouts when Derek and Stiles walk out onto the field holding hands a few days later.
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Hey, Mom. I want to reintroduce you to Derek Hale. My boyfriend."
Reponse: "It's nice to meet you again, Mrs. Stilinski."
title: Just the Same
author: foxlavender

Dialogue: "Good news," Superman piped up, "They're force is relatively small. No need to bring in earthen governments."
Reponse: "Bad news," Wonderwoman said, "we don't have enough people to deal with it."
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: Connor frowned. "One miracule doesn't equal many."
Reponse: M'gann laughed and touched his arm. "We'll see."
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: The man cocked his head, followed by his weapons. "They still hurt like a b*tch."
Reponse: Dick sighed. "But you won't actually shoot me. B would be mad."
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: Red Hood smirked. "I died. I got better. Nice to see ya, M'gann."
Reponse: "Oh, hey Hood." Tim said. "Kory." He nodded politely. "Roy."
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "What's up, B*tches? I have arrived!"
Reponse: "Excuse me?" the girl asked. "How dare you disrespect the Purple People Eater!"
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: The girl laughed. "I'm his ex!" She strolled out from the zeta platform, lowering her arms. She halted when a voice called from the door.
Reponse: "Dead Robins' Club, where you at?!"
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "What's her deal with waffles?" Garfield added.
Reponse: Jaime raised his hand. "She gets an allowance?"
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: Virgil shook his head. "Anyone else confused about what just happened?"
Reponse: "How'd she do the thing with the glitter," Zatanna asked.
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "Who is she?" Cassie repeated.
Reponse: "That was Stephanie Brown. She's usually the current Batgirl, but after a few ... less than savory encounters with a villain called Condiment King, her uniform is ... in for repairs. So she's going by her first moniker: Spoiler. She's also the fourth Robin. Waffles are her favorite food, and she requires them to function. She gets an allowance, and basically lives with me and my family, all of whom think it's funny to steal my credit cards. She and Tim dated for a while, but now she's proclaimed herschel to be 'too good for him anyway'. I ... don't know how she deals with glitter. It's apparently a trade secret."
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: Beast Boy was the only one brave enough to speak. "Hi! I'm Garfield!" he said, stepping forward. "Who are you? And how do you know Batman? Also, that's a cool sword! "
Reponse: "My name is Jean-Paul Valley," he answered, smiling. "Although when I am wearing the mask I am known as Azrael. That is the Sword of Sin, I'm glad you like it. And Batman and I have known each other for years, we both work in Gotham."
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "What's going on?" He asked, warily watching the crowd of heroes encircling the Dark Knight.
Reponse: "Did you know that Thor-Copy-Cat was Batman?!" L'gaan demanded, whirling on the former Robin.
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "Thor copy-cat?" Dick asked.
Reponse: "He means Jean-Paul." They looked over to find Jason leaning against a wall, still nursing his shoulder with an ice pack.
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "Well besides Batgirl...."
Reponse: "You really are adorable," Jason said, checking his phone for the time. "This'll be great."
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "He's showing emotion!" Jason cried. "Watch out! The world's about to end!"
Reponse: Dick shook his head. "He acted caringly. I've waited years for this."
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: There were several scoffs. "Dick's right, Bruce," Batwing said, "It's pretty rare. And I've known you for longer than him."
Reponse: "Attention all members of the Justice League, and strangely unnamed Team (y'know, you should really fix that). Please listen closely." she paused dramatically. "Whichever speedster ate my third plate of waffles when I wasn't looking: your doom is inevitable. I saw the skid marks. There's no denying this. Not even Batman can stop me."
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: Dick laughed. "You're just jealous. You know if all of us are here, there'd be no need for the league."
Reponse: Wally frowned "I mean, that's true, but still."
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: He nodded again. "Tell me, does Bruce ever stop adopting?"
Reponse: Bart froze, his eyes wide. "Um ... how many are currently in the family?"
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: Batwing snorted beneath his helmet. "Too many."
Reponse: "Admit it, B," Dick said, an easy smile on his face.
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "Unrecogised, D-09. Override: Batman 02"
Reponse: The girl grinned and walked forward. "Hiya, Brucie! What's chilling? Dick. Jason. Tim. You guys good?"
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: The girl leapt to her feet. "Oh my gosh, are you okay? I'm so sorry! The gun must have malfunctioned! I just recalibrated it earlier."
Reponse: She tilted her head - not looking too concerned - and turned to Jason. "Yo, Hood, you know guns. Mind checking mine for me?"
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: Jason grinned. "Why, Bluebird, it would be my pleasure!"
Reponse: "Sorry, Narrows, I can't seem to figure out -"
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: Jason jumped back, eyes wide. "Oh yeah, there's something really wrong with that." he glanced over at Batman, who was glaring at him. "Clearly not a fault of the operator. You might wanna get it checked out."
Reponse: "Yo, I'm really sorry," she announces before bending down and grabbing his shoulders. She paused for a moment before pulling him up.
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "Those are for Spoiler's Waffles."
Reponse: "Are you alright?" she asked over the mindlink.
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "Are you alright?" she asked over the mindlink.
Reponse: "Yeah," he replied, purposefully not giving a reason. M'gann seemed to understand and turned back to watch the bats.
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "Yeah," he replied, purposefully not giving a reason. M'gann seemed to understand and turned back to watch the bats.
Reponse: "Well," she said, "fate has a funny way of divvying out vengeance, doesn't it?"
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "Well," she said, "fate has a funny way of divvying out vengeance, doesn't it?"
Reponse: She twirled and stalked over to Bluebird. "What's up roomie?" she asked, and the pair fist bumped.
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: Stephanie nodded solemnly "it is no light thing to be away from our fellow sisters."
Reponse: Batman sighed heavily. "Why are you like this?"
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "That's right, ladies and gentlemen!" Bluebird proclaimed, "You are in the presence of the one and only: Cassandra Cain-Wayne!"
Reponse: "The daughter of Lady Shiva and David Cain, our lady and savior was raised from birth to be an assassin, she was never taught to speak." Spoiler announced dramatically.
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "The daughter of Lady Shiva and David Cain, our lady and savior was raised from birth to be an assassin, she was never taught to speak." Spoiler announced dramatically.
Reponse: "But she persevered!" Bluebird continued. "She escaped when she was only a wee babe and after years of toil and misfortune, made her way to the fearful land of Gotham!"
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "From then on, she was proclaimed the deadliest person on earth, in her mother's stead. She returned to Gotham, and was adopted by Batman ('cause this guy really can't resist small, traumatized kids, sheesh) and truly became a member of the family."
Reponse: "From then on, she claimed the one true title that outshone all the rest, the one that was destined for her since birth."
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "From then on, she claimed the one true title that outshone all the rest, the one that was destined for her since birth."
Reponse: The pair looked at each other. "Bruce's favorite child."
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: The pair looked at each other. "Bruce's favorite child."
Reponse: "Hear her name and tremble!" Spoiler cried out, "oh she who is next in line for the mantle of the Dark Knight. Oh she who has Batman wrapped around her little finger!"
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: Batman looked to Black Bat with something akin to pride in his expression. "Yes, Cassandra is a skilled and accomplished warrior. But I don't have a favorite child."
Reponse: The young woman preened under the praise, before seeming to frown. "Yes, you do," she proclaimed, tapping her chest.
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: Batman frowned right back at her. "Why don't you go cause chaos with Harper and Stephanie?"
Reponse: She nodded. "The truth is hard. I understand."
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "Bat." her red lips had a flirtatious smirk to them.
Reponse: It was the Dark Knight who replied. "Cat," he said, just as tense.
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "Where's the bleach?!"
Reponse: "I am tainted!"
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: Harley grinned and initiated some kind of intricate handshake, including two twists, a "feigned" sucker punch, and both of them collapsing to the floor, clutching their guts like they'd been stabbed. All in all, it was a much more violent version of Spoiler's and Robin's from earlier.
Reponse: "How ya doin' Red?" Harley asked as she rose from the floor, "you missed our last therapy session!"
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: Jason rolled his eyes. "Really? I thought the point was to b*tch about the Joker together?"
Reponse: Harley gasped, clutching her chest. "How dare you profane my good profession! I only live to serve, not talk about my sh**ty ex!"
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: Dick snorted, coming over. "Don't you have your license revoked?"
Reponse: Harley shook her head. "That hasn't stopped you from coming."
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "Homework?" several people asked.
Reponse: Harley looked betrayed. "Are you telling me Batsy over there didn't tell you we're friends? Have been since medical school!"
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "And then you became criminally insane, and murdered people" Batman countered, cutting off the several boiling questions the occupants of the room wanted answered. Unfortunately, it just doubled the amount.
Reponse: "Well, you dropped out and fought crime in a leather and kevlar fursuit, so who really has it worse?"
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "Sounds fun!" Harley replied, bouncing over and slinging her arm under Ivy's elbow.
Reponse: The two strolled out together - apparently knowing which way to go? - but not before Harley turned and called over her shoulder, "Farewell my little munchkins!"
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "You're married to a villainess-"
Reponse: "Anti-hero, darling."
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "-and your kids' honorary aunts are also villains?" Flash asked, after Batman had - oh so reluctantly - explained what the heck had just happened. "What's next!? You use the League of Shadows for babysitting?!"
Reponse: "That," a newly returned Luke Fox - muttered, "is scarily accurate."
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "Hold on," Conner said to him before looking back at the stranger. "Who are you?"
Reponse: "The Signal," he answered somewhat hesitantly, "I'm from Gotham. B's newest protege."
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: The teen seemed to blinked beneath his helmet. "Not that I know of?"
Reponse: "Have you ever been Batman?"
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "Nope, and I don't want to."
Reponse: "Do you wish Batman contacted you more?"
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "Do you wish Batman contacted you more?"
Reponse: "We live in the same house, so ... no?"
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: This time, the teenager laughed. "Oh, did Harper get here before me?"
Reponse: "Answer the question!"
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "Answer the question!"
Reponse: "No, I do not. I'm just here to help out with some alien invasion, then head home and finish my english homework."
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "First of all," Jason replied as Signal and Bluebird continued to stare at each other, "You're one to talk. Demon Brat?"
Reponse: Tim cringed. "That's-"
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "We'll find out one day." Signal replied.
Reponse: "Yeah, we'll discover it's me!"
title: All Hands on Deck (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "Your ... water?" Dick asked slowly.

Dialogue: "I'd rather you not refer to me at all," Regulus said brightly.
Reponse: Sirius' voice brought him jarringly back to reality. "That's thirty," he said, something in his tone that James couldn't pinpoint.
title: the art of hiding
author: pinkpalaceapartments

Dialogue: "James, Reg, you're both the best at Potions in the year," Sirius began.
Reponse: "Evans is much better than me," James interrupted.
title: the art of hiding
author: pinkpalaceapartments

Dialogue: "Sirius' potion smells like peaches, not you."
Reponse: "No, it smells all minty like those leaves you chew on," James shot back. Sirius didn't bother asking how James knew Regulus chewed on mint leaves. People with crushes were entirely off their rocker. He could say this, because his crush on Remus had been extreme, even by his standards.
title: the art of hiding
author: pinkpalaceapartments

Dialogue: Regulus narrowed his eyes. "What potion is it supposed to be anyway?" he asked Sirius, "I can't really help if I don't know what you're brewing."
Reponse: Sirius smirked. "Amortentia."
title: the art of hiding
author: pinkpalaceapartments

Dialogue: Sirius smirked. "Amortentia."
Reponse: It was almost comical, how the color drained from both of their faces simultaneously. They took nervous steps apart, and James immediately began sputtering, "Oh, that's why I smell lilies, then, like Lily. Uh, Evans. Who I love."
title: the art of hiding
author: pinkpalaceapartments

Dialogue: "No you weren't," Sirius said with a laugh, "We were all there, James kissed you."
Reponse: Regulus looked confused. "What? You-- you were there?"
title: the art of hiding
author: pinkpalaceapartments

Dialogue: Regulus looked confused. "What? You-- you were there?"
Reponse: "He means during the party, Reggie," James said.
title: the art of hiding
author: pinkpalaceapartments

Dialogue: "The party," Regulus said.
Reponse: "James?" Sirius asked, because James couldn't tell a damn lie to save his life.
title: the art of hiding
author: pinkpalaceapartments

Dialogue: "James?" Sirius asked, because James couldn't tell a damn lie to save his life.
Reponse: "Holidays," James said quietly.
title: the art of hiding
author: pinkpalaceapartments

Dialogue: "What was that?"
Reponse: "Holidays," he muttered again, a bit louder. Regulus shut his eyes like he'd seen his fate and was awaiting the final blow.
title: the art of hiding
author: pinkpalaceapartments

Dialogue: James and Regulus blinked at Sirius, then at each other. The corner of James' mouth quirked up like he was about to laugh, and Regulus groaned, shaking his head. "Jamie, no, don't--"
Reponse: "I've been dating Reg since the winter holidays. He kissed me, and I kissed him back, and then we spent days being ridiculous about it, and then we kissed some more, and then I asked him to go on a date with me once we got back to school. We did, we decided to make our relationship official, and we've been together since," James explained.
title: the art of hiding
author: pinkpalaceapartments

Dialogue: "I've been dating Reg since the winter holidays. He kissed me, and I kissed him back, and then we spent days being ridiculous about it, and then we kissed some more, and then I asked him to go on a date with me once we got back to school. We did, we decided to make our relationship official, and we've been together since," James explained.
Reponse: Sirius dropped his mouth open. No, he was lying. But James was such a bad liar. He turned to his brother. "Reg?"
title: the art of hiding
author: pinkpalaceapartments

Dialogue: Sirius dropped his mouth open. No, he was lying. But James was such a bad liar. He turned to his brother. "Reg?"
Reponse: Regulus shrugged, defeated. "I'm not sorry about it. You don't own him."
title: the art of hiding
author: pinkpalaceapartments

Dialogue: "Fucking--" Sirius ran a hasty hand through his hair and opened up his arms. "Come here."
Reponse: Regulus glanced at James, ignoring Sirius' arms. Sirius sighed. "Come here you little arsehole. Give me a hug."
title: the art of hiding
author: pinkpalaceapartments

Dialogue: He didn't wait for Regulus this time, just pulled him in by the arm and folded him to his chest. "You won't ever lose me again," he said softly into Regulus' shoulder, "I promise."
Reponse: Some of the tension left Regulus' body as he hugged Sirius back, a bit awkwardly. They weren't used to doing this. "I'm sorry for not telling you."
title: the art of hiding
author: pinkpalaceapartments

Dialogue: Regulus peeked at James out of the corner of his eyes, going brilliantly red. "I... yeah. I am."
Reponse: Sirius turned to James, who opened his arms for a hug. Sirius crossed his own arms. "My fucking brother?"
title: the art of hiding
author: pinkpalaceapartments

Dialogue: Sirius sighed. "You love him, don't you?"
Reponse: "I'm right here," Regulus said.
title: the art of hiding
author: pinkpalaceapartments

Dialogue: "Of course I do. More than anything," James said, not missing a beat.
Reponse: "Oh, bloody hell," Sirius repeated, stepping forward and letting James hug the life out of him. "You two are going to be insufferable now, aren't you?" Sirius asked once James released him.
title: the art of hiding
author: pinkpalaceapartments

Dialogue: "Oh, bloody hell," Sirius repeated, stepping forward and letting James hug the life out of him. "You two are going to be insufferable now, aren't you?" Sirius asked once James released him.
Reponse: "Have you met yourself and Remus?" Regulus asked.
title: the art of hiding
author: pinkpalaceapartments

Dialogue: "Touche."
Reponse: "Have you really been trying to set us up?" James asked.
title: the art of hiding
author: pinkpalaceapartments

Dialogue: "Have you really been trying to set us up?" James asked.
Reponse: Sirius huffed out a breathless laugh. "Like you wouldn't believe. I'm driving Moony insane. He thinks you two are a lost cause."
title: the art of hiding
author: pinkpalaceapartments

Dialogue: He found Remus in the library with Lily. "You bloody knew?" he asked, with no preamble.
Reponse: "Hello, Padfoot. How was your day? Mine was alright, Lils and I were just finishing up Transfiguration work," Remus said, not even looking up from his parchment. Lily snickered to herself. Remus glanced up through his lashes. "To answer your question: yes. Why didn't I tell you? Not my business to tell. How'd you find out?"
title: the art of hiding
author: pinkpalaceapartments

Dialogue: Sirius scoffed in exasperation. "She knows too?!"
Reponse: "Not by choice," she said.
title: the art of hiding

Dialogue: Hermione was halfway down the stairs when she heard Harry call her name. She waved at him over her shoulder, but kept up her power walk to the Defense corridor. Just as she reached the classroom, Harry grabbed her arm. He was panting lightly; apparently he had run a bit to keep up with her. "Bloody hell, Hermione," he protested mildly.
Reponse: "I need to ask a question," Hermione explained, tugging open the classroom door. "Professor Moody?" she called.
title: A Stubbornly Persistent Illusion
author: ChokolatteJedi

Dialogue: Professor Moody emerged from his office into the classroom, as Hermione was pulling out her notebook and pen. "I haven't had your lot yet," he said gruffly.
Reponse: "You haven't," Hermione agreed quickly. "I'm Hermione Granger, and this is Harry Potter." Professor Moody looked a little surprised at that, but she had gotten used to that reaction over the last few years with Harry.
title: A Stubbornly Persistent Illusion
author: ChokolatteJedi

Dialogue: "Good idea!" Moody declared. "You can never be too careful! It would be a good thing for you to learn too, Potter."
Reponse: "Yes sir," Harry said politely.
title: A Stubbornly Persistent Illusion
author: ChokolatteJedi

Dialogue: "Yes sir," Harry said politely.
Reponse: "There are three classes of detection charms," Moody launched into a lecture, and Hermione hastened to take notes; she slid over to the closest desk so she didn't have to balance her notebook in her hand. "Detecting people and creatures, detecting spell work, and detecting potions work. There's medical ones too, but those aren't relevant."
title: A Stubbornly Persistent Illusion
author: ChokolatteJedi

Dialogue: "Where would we find those charts?" Harry asked, surprising Hermione that he seemed quite interested in the topic.
Reponse: "NEWT level defense texts should have them; so should your potions text," Professor Moody said, stroking his chin. "Your standard Potions text from this year should have the information too. It only takes a few seconds for a competent potions teacher to tell you the key color or trait of a potion as you're making it, so you can pick these things up as you go. Course, you lot've got Snape, so I'm sure he's never mentioned it."
title: A Stubbornly Persistent Illusion
author: ChokolatteJedi

Dialogue: "The spells themselves don't require any degree of power," Professor Moody continued. "The motion for the first is a slight jab and the second's a wave. You can chain them together, once you have each one down pat."
Reponse: So saying, he pulled out his wand. "First for testing liquids, the jab," he demonstrated, "and say 'Pepurigoso'."
title: A Stubbornly Persistent Illusion
author: ChokolatteJedi

Dialogue: "Good. It's got about a meter radius, but that only works if you can see inside the container the liquid is in. So if you're sitting together, you could do it once for both cups, but you probably couldn't see into the cup of the person four down, even if it would analyze it. Got it?"
Reponse: "Yes sir," Hermione said, jotting that down.
title: A Stubbornly Persistent Illusion
author: ChokolatteJedi

Dialogue: "Yes sir," Hermione said, jotting that down.
Reponse: "Good, now that works for liquids of any size, in theory. A barrel, a puddle, whatever. The hitch comes in when your body of water is considerably bigger than the spell range. For example, you could stand at the edge of the Black Lake and cast that. If I had dumped a potion in the middle of the lake, it would be so far away from you that you couldn't detect it. Even if I was only a few meters away, it would probably dilute so quickly that you still couldn't detect it. Now, if the whole lake was tainted by something, like litres and litres dumped into it, the spell would work."
title: A Stubbornly Persistent Illusion
author: ChokolatteJedi

Dialogue: "Do these detect poisons as well?" Harry asked.
Reponse: Professor Moody looked pleased at the question. "In a way. If it is a known potions ingredient, venom, or toxin, then yes. Otherwise? Possibly."
title: A Stubbornly Persistent Illusion
author: ChokolatteJedi

Dialogue: Professor Moody looked pleased at the question. "In a way. If it is a known potions ingredient, venom, or toxin, then yes. Otherwise? Possibly."
Reponse: "What about Muggle chemicals?" Hermione asked. She knew that most wizards weren't familiar with such things, but for someone as paranoid as the Professor appeared to be, he was quite certain that he had also looked into such things. And if not, he likely soon will.
title: A Stubbornly Persistent Illusion
author: ChokolatteJedi

Dialogue: "Now you two try it, the general first and then the food one," Moody instructed.
Reponse: "Good!" Moody declared. "Now take something simple you've got on hand and dump it in a cup of water and on some snack. Test it until you can actually get the results correct. Then you'll be good to go. Now, off to dinner with you,"
title: A Stubbornly Persistent Illusion
author: ChokolatteJedi

Dialogue: "I'm not sure," Hermione said, nibbling her lip. Her note to herself had indicated it was necessary, but she couldn't exactly tell Harry that. "I know that over the summer, the twins mentioned something in passing about pranking food, and after seeing the Professor testing his own food... I just thought it might be useful to learn." All true statements, just slightly obfuscating her real motivation.
Reponse: "That makes sense," Harry agreed. "So we need to check out a potions book to find out what we detect, right?"
title: A Stubbornly Persistent Illusion
author: ChokolatteJedi

Dialogue: "You really want to learn this right away," Hermione mused, pleasantly surprised.
Reponse: "Last year, when we were in the infirmary and Snape and the Minister came rushing in?" he asked. Hermione nodded to show she knew what he was talking about. "They mentioned Veritaserum. I asked Percy, and he said it was a truth serum. I know enough from Muggle - normal - movies and telly to know that's usually a liquid that goes in your water or something. And the way Snape's glaring at me again, I wouldn't put it past him." Harry explained.
title: A Stubbornly Persistent Illusion
author: ChokolatteJedi

Dialogue: "Should we invite Ron?" Harry asked, as they turned the last corner to the Great Hall.
Reponse: Hermione considered that. "We could, but I have two reasons not to,"
title: A Stubbornly Persistent Illusion
author: ChokolatteJedi

Dialogue: Hermione considered that. "We could, but I have two reasons not to,"
Reponse: Ron would have jumped in angrily, but Harry just looked at her expectantly. "First of all, we don't want to advertise that we're searching for potions in our food and drink just yet, in case that tips off someone like Professor Snape. Ron has a tendency to speak without thinking, and he's not subtle in his wandwork."
title: A Stubbornly Persistent Illusion
author: ChokolatteJedi

Dialogue: Ron would have jumped in angrily, but Harry just looked at her expectantly. "First of all, we don't want to advertise that we're searching for potions in our food and drink just yet, in case that tips off someone like Professor Snape. Ron has a tendency to speak without thinking, and he's not subtle in his wandwork."
Reponse: Harry nodded his agreement to the first point, so Hermione pressed on. "Second, if the twins are planning to potion our food or drink, we don't want them tipped off either, and you know Ron can't lie to them convincingly."
title: A Stubbornly Persistent Illusion
author: ChokolatteJedi

Dialogue: "There is that," Hermione said, pursing her lips. She honestly did not understand Ron's overblown laziness. She had given this a lot of thought over the last few years, and come to no logical conclusions. She had eventually filed it into her mental index under "things about Ronald Wealsey that make no sense" and done her best to forget about it.
Reponse: The meal seemed to crawl, but finally dinner was over. Harry and Hermione had eaten slightly less than usual, but were still finished long before Ron, as normal. Fortunately, it gave them a chance to slip away without needing an excuse. Harry had also pocketed some dinner rolls to test. "See you later," Harry offered, and Ron simply waved without taking his eyes from his plate.
title: A Stubbornly Persistent Illusion
author: ChokolatteJedi

Dialogue: "I'll grab some potions from my trunk, and fetch the library books," Hermione explained. "You go get some water from the bathroom."
Reponse: Harry nodded, but then looked worried. "You can't do the cup transfiguration yet?" she asked. It was the first spell in their fourth year text, but if Harry hadn't read ahead at all... Hermione suppressed a sigh. "Come up to Gryffindor with me, then, and get some empty Potions vials. Get a handful, just in case. Then meet me back at that classroom." She pointed to her haven again.
title: A Stubbornly Persistent Illusion
author: ChokolatteJedi

Reponse: "Alright," Harry agreed easily.

Dialogue: "Alright," Harry agreed easily.
Reponse: Aiming at the third one, she performed the proper jab. "Pepurigoso." The flask took on a very faint red hue for a second, but it was gone before she could blink.
title: A Stubbornly Persistent Illusion
author: ChokolatteJedi

Dialogue: "Well done!" Harry cheered.
Reponse: "You saw it, then?" Hermione asked, pleased.
title: A Stubbornly Persistent Illusion

Dialogue: "You saw it, then?" Hermione asked, pleased.
Reponse: "Redish, yeah?" Harry agreed.
