Dialogue: "Yeah, around half an hour ago, I could suddenly feel you here." She shrugs. "And I've been able to hear you for the past half-mile, or so."
Reponse: "The past half-mile?"
title: Eddie Munson's Vampire Mixtape
author: Springandastorm

Dialogue: Eddie's eyes feel wet. "I don't know if I deserve that."
Reponse: "You saved me." She says simply. "And that's pretty  heroic, if you ask me." She shakes her fist. "Are you going to leave me hanging?"
title: Eddie Munson's Vampire Mixtape
author: Springandastorm

Dialogue: Lucas holds his up, too. "Thank you, Eddie. It means more than we can tell you."
Reponse: "So, did we just get all of these weapons for no reason?" Robin asks, dumping them in a pile on the floor.
title: Eddie Munson's Vampire Mixtape
author: Springandastorm

Dialogue: "Steve, you've got two walking D&D encyclopedias right here." Eddie says, reaching out to ruffle Will and Dustin's hair. "If  they couldn't teach you, nobody can."
Reponse: Robin drags Vickie over, their hands tightly knit, and she pulls Eddie into  another hug. "I missed you." She says. "Vickie had to deal with me talking her ear off about you every day."
title: Eddie Munson's Vampire Mixtape
author: Springandastorm

Dialogue: "Vickie, I presume?" Eddie asks, reaching out to shake her hand.
Reponse: "The one and only!" She says, giving him an enthusiastic handshake. "I like your rings!"
title: Eddie Munson's Vampire Mixtape
author: Springandastorm

Dialogue: "We're calling them mouseboxes now?" Eddie interrupts.
Reponse: "Makes it less gross." Max says. "El suggested it."
title: Eddie Munson's Vampire Mixtape
author: Springandastorm

Dialogue: "You slept the  entire time?" Nancy asks, incredulous.
Reponse: Eddie shrugs. "Pretty much."
title: Eddie Munson's Vampire Mixtape
author: Springandastorm

Dialogue: Max nods, tapping along the edges of the tape. "Lucas showed me your vampire mix-tape. Listening to it helped me through the first few days."
Reponse: "Oh, yeah? What do you think?"
title: Eddie Munson's Vampire Mixtape
author: Springandastorm

Dialogue: "Mhm. I don't wanna deal with my parents right now. And I figured you might be, um..." His tongue darts out across his lower lip. "Hungry."
Reponse: Into  his ear, she whispers "You're welcome."
title: Eddie Munson's Vampire Mixtape
author: Springandastorm

Dialogue: When they go inside, everything is mostly as he'd left it, his books and music spread out everywhere and the couch folded down. "Um, on the couch?" Steve asks, standing awkwardly in the middle of the room.
Reponse: "Mhm." Eddie says, letting his voice dip lower. "Maybe you really  are  under the  vampiric thrall  of a  creature of the night,  Steve. You keep  offering your tender flesh."  He doesn't feel nearly as confident as he sounds doing his stupid fake Transylvanian accent, in fact he feels a little bit like he's going to vomit, but it's easier to make Steve the nervous one, for once, to gorge himself on how easy it is to make his heartbeat speed up, to make his big brown eyes look all melty.
title: Eddie Munson's Vampire Mixtape
author: Springandastorm

Dialogue: Steve nods silently, looking a bit like his entire world has shifted on its axis, which does  wonders for Eddie's ego. "Fuck."
Reponse: Later, after they've spent both  far too long  and  nearly not enough doing nothing but kiss and kiss and kiss, Eddie's head is on Steve's chest, his legs pulled up. "Are we a cliche?" He asks, thoughtful.
title: Eddie Munson's Vampire Mixtape
author: Springandastorm

Dialogue: "Is 'creature of the night' a reference to something?" Steve asks once he's finally untangled. "You say that a lot."
Reponse: "Oh, man." Eddie says, sitting up. "You haven't seen  Rocky Horror, have you?"
title: Eddie Munson's Vampire Mixtape
author: Springandastorm

Dialogue: "Oh, Steve." Eddie sighs, leaning back against him. "I'm going to show you  so much."
Reponse: Steve slides a hand under his jaw again, tilting his head up. His eyes gleam. "Promise?"
title: Eddie Munson's Vampire Mixtape
author: Springandastorm

Dialogue: "Because it's good PR," Pepper flatly replied.
Reponse: Tony sat up a little taller in his seat and pursed his lips. "No. Absolutely not," he said. When Pepper began to lift a finger towards him, he decided that perhaps it would be wise to offer some sort of compromise. "Look, how about I sign a poster and then meet the kid somewhere nice and public to give it to them."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: With her eyes still narrowed, Pepper smirked. "If you had been listening to me, then you would know that I've already arranged it. The kid's social worker is bringing him over on Saturday to have lunch with us. Then he'll spend some time with you in your lab," she said, then gestured towards Tony's faded jeans and oil stained t-shirt. "Dress nice, the media team will be out front when you meet him."
Reponse: Tony wanted to argue that there were at least three thousand reasons why inviting anyone, especially a kid, into his lab was a horrible idea. But rather than taking the time to come up with a reasonable example, he scoffed and hurriedly spat out the first thing that popped into his head. "Do we even know anything about this kid? What if he's a spy for some other tech company coming in here to infiltrate and steal my ideas."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Don't worry about it, Peter. They just want to take a few pictures and if they try asking you any questions, I'll take care of it. Okay?"
Reponse: "And now the moment you've been waiting for!" the foundation representative boomed towards the audience more so than Peter. "Peter, are you ready to meet the Invincible Iron Man? Because here he is! Mr. Tony Stark!"
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Not much of a talker is he," Tony casually stated, making Peter stomach churn with unease. He had no idea what the man was going with his assessment and wasn't really sure how to properly defend himself. Thankfully, he didn't have to.
Reponse: "Peter has what they call selective mutism," Mrs. Braswell tightly replied. "So, no. I suppose he's not much of a talker."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "First of all, I would like to make it very clear that speech is not a marker of intelligence. And I can assure you that Peter communicates just fine, in his own way" Mrs. Braswell said and Peter smiled. Mrs. Braswell had been his social worker for a very long time and she always advocated for him. Even when some of his teachers and a few potential adoptive families had insisted that she was perpetuating his silence by doing so.
Reponse: "I'm sure Peter is an extremely intelligent boy," Pepper said while easily vacillating between smiling at Mrs. Braswell and glaring daggers into the side of Tony's head. "He goes to Midtown School of Science and Technology, right?"
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: The Elevators in Stark Tower had been designed to be as efficient as possible. Therefore, it took very little time to reach the requested lower level. The doors propped open with a ding and Tony escorted Peter down a broad corridor, stopping short just outside of the ballistic glass wall. "Well, this is it," he said as he scanned his hand for entrance, smirking when the kid's eyes grew wide the moment they stepped inside.
Reponse: The tour of the lab didn't go entirely as Tony had originally imagined it would. He'd been expecting an eagerly rambling and inquisitive child. But Peter remained as quiet as ever for the entire lap around the room. "I know it looks sort of cluttered and chaotic but that's how I do my best work," he said once they'd made it back to where they had started.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Great. Do you build or program?" he asked, hoping to narrow down what sort of things he had laid around the lab that might be of interest. At that moment, it struck him that the kid wasn't likely to answer the question as he'd phrased it. "Right. One at a time," he mumbled mostly to himself. "Do you do the engineering?" he asked and was pleased to get a positive reaction.
Reponse: "What about code, do you do that too?" he asked next.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: Without ever shifting his eyes off of the schematics, Tony picked up the half-crumpled piece of paper and held it up for the social worker to see. "Bathroom," he distractedly replied, only looking up once he'd finally gotten the two troublesome pieces of hardware to properly snap together. "Don't worry. I didn't lose him."
Reponse: "Well, good," Mrs. Braswell replied. "Because that would require a lot more paperwork than either one of us wants to deal with."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "I thought we weren't going to have to see you until dinner," Marcus smirked before heaving a football across the yard. "Did Tony Stark kick you out? I bet that's a good story."
Reponse: "Even if it is, we both know he'll never tell you," Carlos scoffed as he caught the ball and began to toss it repeatedly into the air. "He probably doesn't even know what happened. Oblivious as always."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Peter!" Ned called out the moment Peter stepped foot inside of the school. They both smiled and hurried towards each other before going through their long since established handshake.
Reponse: "Dude! We have fifteen minutes before homeroom. You've got to tell me about meeting Mr. Stark!" Ned said as he followed Peter towards his locker.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: Flash drew his head back, looking aghast. "What did you just say to me?" he snapped but MJ looked entirely undaunted.
Reponse: "Nothing worth repeating," she said and then grabbed one of the straps on Peter's backpack. "Let's go, Peter. We've got two minutes until the late bell," he said and started tugging Peter past Flash and down the hallway.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Tony?" Pepper questioned, compelling Tony to look up from the gauntlet he was attempting to rewire. "Why do I have an email from Peter's social worker requesting more information on the invitation you issued last Saturday?"
Reponse: "That is an excellent question and it deserves an extremely thorough answer," Tony, then leaned down to collect a pair of wire strippers from a lower shelf. "But unfortunately, as you can see, I'm in the middle of some super important stuff here."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: With a grunt of frustration, Pepper took a step forward and casually removed the tool from Tony's hand. "I'm serious Tony," she pressed. "Did you actually tell the kid he could come back?"
Reponse: Knowing he was left with no other choice than to simply answer the question, Tony leaned back in his chair and kicked his feet up onto the table. "Technically? Yes," he replied, then crossed his arms loosely over his chest.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Hear me out, Pep," Tony defensively replied. Though he wasn't sure what he had to be defensive about. It was his lab. If he wanted to invite someone into it, that was his prerogative. Moreover, he didn't think that allowing the kid over for one more little visit was that big of a deal. Just because he knew the offer had been made on a whim, didn't mean she needed to know that. And if he worded everything just right he could make it sound like he was simply being generous. It seemed like the right way to advance.
Reponse: "Fine. I'm listening," Pepper sighed but there was a glint of amusement in her eyes.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Pete?" he heard Tony say and despite the pit in his stomach, he forced himself to look up. However, the eye-contact wasn't as uncomfortable as he thought it would be. Tony's posture wasn't hostile and his eyes were shining with nothing but mirth.
Reponse: "Kid. You're not in trouble for looking. If I didn't want you to see it, FRIDAY wouldn't have allowed it," Tony said, then cocked his head to the side and smiled. "Something take your fancy?"
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Peter, Sweetie. It's time to go," the social worker whispered, causing Peter to frown. There was still a lot to do, and he definitely didn't want to abandon his task before it was complete. Rather than argue, he pulled out his memo pad and looked pleadingly towards Tony.
Reponse: "Sorry Peter," Mrs. Braswell sighed. "But I have to go, which means you have to go."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: Exasperatedly, Ned threw both of his hands into the air. "Why can't you throw him off by, I don't know- not going out on patrol? Just for a week or so. You could come hang out with me at my house after school. We could eat snacks and play video games. Wouldn't that be a safer option?"
Reponse: "You know I am. I just-" Ned said, followed by a deep breath and a shake of his head. "Never mind. What did you have in mind? I'll see what I can add."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Uh," Tony replied while trying to decide the best way to respond to that question. He wasn't sure putting in a file was a good idea. He didn't want anyone to go through his database and get the wrong idea. Especially Pepper. God, he'd never hear the end of it. And it wasn't like he planned on going through with anything. He was just researching for the sake of researching.
Reponse: "Just- talk it out with me, FRI," he ultimately decided. "Maybe privately bookmark any pertinent websites. Nothing obvious. I want to keep this little information binge on the down-low. Yeah?"
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "No," Pepper skeptically replied, then set down her sandwich and narrowed her eyes. "Why do you ask?"
Reponse: Tony shrugged his shoulders and forced his face to remain neutral. "Nothing important, really," he casually expressed. "It's just that I had told her I wouldn't mind seeing the kid again. You know, to provide him the opportunity to get in there and stretch his brain a little bit," he said but before he could get much further his AI was jumping to life.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Nothing!" Tony immediately and defensively clipped. "I don't have to do anything because I don't need to be certified. If I have to work around the social worker's schedule, so be it."
Reponse: "You, Tony Stark, are going to 'work around' someone else's schedule?" Pepper skeptically inquired. "That doesn't sound like something you would do."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Hey are you that Spider-Guy?" one of them shouted.
Reponse: "Spider-Man" Another corrected, followed by "Can you do a flip?"
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "What has you in such a pleasant mood?" Pepper asked, as she stepped cautiously through the sliding glass doors.
Reponse: "Nothing," Tony replied, while making an effort to return his face back to neutral. "I'm not even in a pleasant mood. I'm in a terrible mood. A terrible mood that you caused by forcing me to go through all of these bug reports. Don't we hire people to carry out this kind of stuff? If not, we should. Because it's tedious, and I don't like it."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "The thing is," Mrs. Braswell tentatively began, "this is an extremely unusual situation. It's not often that foster children have the opportunity to establish any sort of meaningful relationship with an adult that isn't a foster parent, a teacher or a state certified individual. The only reason we've been able to do this as many times as we have, is because of Mr. Stark's sway and my ability to convince my superiors that these visits are in Peter's best interest. However, I don't know how long that will hold up. So for the time being, we're going to have to take these plans one at a time," she said, although the last bit seemed to have been directed at Peter more so than anyone else.
Reponse: "Hey, kid. Think you can go grab some extra plates and napkins out of the break room over there?" he asked, waiting for Peter to nod his head before offering any further directions. "They should be in one of those lower cabinets. You might have to dig around a little until you find them, yeah?" he said and that was enough to send the kid skittering across the large room. Although he waited until Peter had fully crossed the threshold in the lounge before casually turning his attention to the social worker.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Do I really have to spell this out for you?" he exasperatedly questioned. He could hear Pepper giggle as the woman shrugged her shoulders. Tony had to take a deep breath to keep himself from asserting anything he would later regret. "I guess my question is: If I was properly certified, would the kid be able to come over to spend unsupervised time in the lab with me on a more regular basis?"
Reponse: Mrs. Braswell appeared to carefully consider the question for a moment before nodding her head. "If his foster parents agreed, then yes. Regular visits to the tower would be something that could be arranged."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "I can't tell you the last time I've seen Peter so eagerly engaged with anyone who isn't his best friend or me," Mrs. Braswell finally uttered. "For that reason alone, I would gladly press for his foster family to take advantage of the opportunity. Peter deserves to have more people in his life that he can trust. Adults especially. "
Reponse: Deciding that it would be more advantageous to unpack that particular information later, Tony cleared his throat and popped open a can of soda. "So," he began before taking a long swig of the fizzy drink. "Hypothetically speaking, how long would you say something like that would take to complete? The certification, I mean."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Yeah, that didn't really answer my question," Tony muttered, then began to peel the meat-like substance off of the roll and set it aside. He sighed heavily as he surveyed what was left on the bread. A piece of bright orange processed cheese, some scattered shredded lettuce and a single slice of tomato. It didn't appear all that appetizing but he really was hungry.  So, he reluctantly took one more bite. It didn't taste any better than it looked.
Reponse: "What's up next?" he grumbled, once he'd abandoned the lackluster sandwich in favor of a small bag of chips.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "What is that supposed to mean? Of course this is something he wants to do. Why wouldn't this be something he wants to do?" Tony argued, because as far as he was concerned regular visits with Peter were already a done deal. He certainly wouldn't have sat through all those classes if he thought for even a minute that it wasn't.  Besides, he was Iron Man and what kid would give up the opportunity to spend several days a week with Iron Man? "Kids love me."
Reponse: "Of course they do," Pepper expertly placated. "But this isn't a comic-con meet and greet. You'll actually be in charge of this kid and he's old enough to decide whether or not he's comfortable with that."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Calm down, Tony," Pepper replied, a profound sigh. "She's going to talk to them when she drops Peter off at home. But I'm sure it will be fine and Peter will be back in the lab by next week. Mrs. Braswell has already said she would advocate for it."
Reponse: Tony blew out a breath and nodded his head. He certainly hoped that would be the case. It had been a little over a week since he'd seen the kid and he was eager to get things started. He'd already pulled up at least six different projects he could potentially work on, including a particularly troublesome upgrade to the Iron Man armor. He could already picture the ecstatic look on Peter's face at the mere mention of the latter. He smiled at the thought, then a small twinge of sadness settled in his chest. "Is it weird that I miss the kid?" he asked. "Because it feels weird that I miss the kid."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: After some thought, he supposed he could just talk to the guy. Maybe build up some trust. If he played his cards right, perhaps Spider-Man would be inclined to share his identity without prompting. However, he wasn't prepared to commit to that course of action just yet. There was still a lot to consider, but was willing to keep the passive option on the table for the time being. With a shake of his head, he began to wonder when the kid's morals had started rubbing off on him. "-I'll cross that bridge when I get to it."
Reponse: "No drones,  for now, " Tony winked before becoming more serious. As much as Peter wanted him to, he couldn't' turn a blind eye to the vigilante's activities. At some point, people were going to start having questions about the up and coming hero's motives, experience and credibility. And he would be expected to know the answers. "I am going to keep a close eye on him, though. Just in case he gets reckless and starts trying to take on jobs that are above his pay grade," he gently explained.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "No drones,  for now, " Tony winked before becoming more serious. As much as Peter wanted him to, he couldn't' turn a blind eye to the vigilante's activities. At some point, people were going to start having questions about the up and coming hero's motives, experience and credibility. And he would be expected to know the answers. "I am going to keep a close eye on him, though. Just in case he gets reckless and starts trying to take on jobs that are above his pay grade," he gently explained.
Reponse: 'Are we still getting pizza tonight?' it said, and Tony was convinced it was an avoidance tactic. Even so, he was content to allow the conversation to shift into more comfortable territory. "I already promised you we would," he said. "I'll even allow you to pick the toppings."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: 'Are we still getting pizza tonight?' it said, and Tony was convinced it was an avoidance tactic. Even so, he was content to allow the conversation to shift into more comfortable territory. "I already promised you we would," he said. "I'll even allow you to pick the toppings."
Reponse: Tony smiled too, and reached over to pat Peter's knee. The car ride had been more strenuous than it was supposed to be. However, he could see the tower in the distance and was glad they would be entering in on a much happier note. "Yeah, Bud," he said softly, followed by an indulgent chuckle. "Awesome."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: Tony nodded his head and hummed in what Peter assumed was agreement before turning his head back towards the ceiling. "You heard the kid, FRIDAY. An extra large with extra cheese," he requested with zeal. "Maybe add a dozen or so wings to the order too, but make 'em mild so the kiddie can have some too."
Reponse: "Perfect," Tony chirped in reply. "That gives us time to start sorting through the clean energy stuff."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Uh-huh," Tony flatly stated. "We'll see if you're still laughing when you fall asleep at that work bench and wake up with a crick in your neck."
Reponse: Tony read the message and playfully narrowed his eyes and quipped, "I'm going to pretend you didn't say that."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Nah, that ain't it," Marcus taunted while making his way over to the stairs. "That would falsely imply that Stark actually wanted him around."
Reponse: "So, you think it's a publicity stunt?" Carlos asked, sounding somewhere between curious and confused. Like he'd already had it all figured out and then Marcus had debunked his theory.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "So, you think it's a publicity stunt?" Carlos asked, sounding somewhere between curious and confused. Like he'd already had it all figured out and then Marcus had debunked his theory.
Reponse: "What publicity?" Marcus scoffed. "There's been nothing on the news since the whole Rewrite the Stars thing."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "This is your chance to explain what happened," she added after several seconds of silence. "-But I'm not going to wait around all day for you to decide to drop the attitude and answer me."
Reponse: "Well, it looks like you decided to finish it, now doesn't it," Mrs. Strickland sarcastically replied.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: Tony helplessly outstretched his hands and then dropped them back down to his sides. "I mean exactly what I said. I haven't seen Peter in days. He came over on Saturday. Got permission to stay the night and I returned him in the morning. Everything was fine and then later that night he texted me saying he wasn't allowed to come back for a while," he agitatedly explained, feeling only slightly bad about his timing. Pepper had just gotten home from her trip and he'd barely said hello to her before blurting out that he'd not laid eyes on Peter in what felt like damn near forever. He knew she was tired. He could see it in her eyes.
Reponse: "Do you know why?" Pepper asked, as she sank down onto the edge of the bed.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: Pepper sighed, and tiredly brushed her bangs away from her forehead. "Did you ask him what happened?" she asked, causing Tony to bristle.
Reponse: "Of course, I asked him what happened!" he said through gritted teeth. It wasn't like he was going to let something like that go without at least trying to collect a few details. Although part of him wondered if she should have pushed a little harder than he had. He groaned as he allowed his body to fall backwards onto the bed. "He didn't want to talk about it."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: Tony responded as requested and waited a few seconds for a new reply. He rolled his eyes as he read through it. "Shockingly, he doesn't know," he said, trying and failing to keep the disappointment out of his voice.
Reponse: After some thought, Pepper sighed. "Why don't you ask him if he wasn't us to call his foster parents? We could try working something out."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: After some thought, Pepper sighed. "Why don't you ask him if he wasn't us to call his foster parents? We could try working something out."
Reponse: Tony hummed in the positive, already typing away. Once he hit send, he sat back and stared at the phone, waiting for an answer. It took longer than he'd anticipated but he couldn't say he was shocked by the replay. "He says, and I quote: 'I'm fine Mr. Stark, really. They have to let me go back over there eventually, right? I'll keep you posted. Thumbs up.' Well, he didn't actually type out 'thumbs up.' That was an emoji, but you get the idea."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "He thinks Spider-Man is injured," Tony murmured. "Apparently there was some sort of rousing conflict going on outside his window and he saw the guy limping into an alley."
Reponse: "Oh," Pepper replied, sounding a little more awake than she had previously. "Are you going to go check on him? She asked. "Spider-Man, I mean. I know you've been dying to talk to him."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Oh," Pepper replied, sounding a little more awake than she had previously. "Are you going to go check on him? She asked. "Spider-Man, I mean. I know you've been dying to talk to him."
Reponse: "Probably," Tony distractedly reasoned. For each minute that had passed since he'd responded to the kid's last text he'd received a new one. He was still trying to catch up. "I mean, yeah. I should probably do that," he repeated, then began typing into his phone. Once he'd hit send, he stood up and stretched. His body was rigid from sitting in one place for so long. "Hey, FRIDAY? Could you be a dear and get the Mark Forty-Seven ready to go?"
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: When Tony landed on the medical floor's wide open balcony, there was already a stretcher there waiting for them. He placed the young man onto it and retracted the armor's face mask. "Keep the mask on," he firmly asserted. "And I need all of you to be ready to sign NDA's the moment my lawyer arrives." He was a little surprised when no one batted an eye. For the first time ever, he wondered what it must be like to work for him.
Reponse: As Spider-Man was rapidly rolled away, Tony stepped out of the suit and located Pepper in the corner of the spacious waiting area. "Did you figure out who he is?" she asked as he narrowed the distance between them.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "No," Tony replied, then gestured towards the swinging double doors, he'd just passed through. "That's Peter, back there. The kid- he's Spider-man," he said and watched as Pepper's hand made its way up to her mouth.
Reponse: "Oh my God, Tony. What do we do?" she breathily inquired.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Oh my God, Tony. What do we do?" she breathily inquired.
Reponse: "I don't know!" Tony clipped then sank down onto one of the uncomfortable plastic chairs. His head fell into his hands, and he began to lightly tug at his hair. He didn't know what to do. He still wasn't sure what to think and there wasn't much to go on. The teenager he was semi-responsible for was enhanced, injured and lying unconscious in his private medical facility. There was a lot to consider, and his brain couldn't seem to slow down long enough to solve one problem before coming up with three more.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: Once more, Tony was baffled by the woman's outward indifference. "He's injured," he incredulously stated. "Aren't you worried?"
Reponse: "Of course, I'm worried," Mrs. Strickland snapped. "But he's not my only responsibility and you're already with him. I'll get there as soon as I reasonably can. You're welcome to call me if anything changes."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "We know the two of you have been texting!" Mrs. Strickland snapped, rather than accepting the hand that Pepper was offering to her. "What did you say to him that would make him sneak off in the middle of the night!"
Reponse: "I didn't tell him to sneak off anywhere!" Tony shot back. He'd already been feeling extraordinarily defensive and her hair-trigger accusations weren't helping the situation. However, he was more than capable of keeping up with her vehement quarreling. "But conceivably if you hadn't been restricting him from coming over for the last two weeks, this wouldn't have happened!"
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "It means," Mrs. Strickland hissed. "That I allowed him to spend one night with you and then all of a sudden he decides to get an attitude. He was arguing and picking fights with two of the other boys the moment he walked in the door. By your influence I'm sure!"
Reponse: "Alright everyone, that's enough! The arguing is getting us nowhere," Mrs. Braswell nearly shouted. Then took a deep breath as she looked between everyone in the room. "As Peter's advocate, I need to know what happened. All of it. I need to know what state of affairs brought on such prolonged restrictions and why on Earth he was wandering around Manhattan, getting mugged at the crack of dawn."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: Tony wondered how long she'd been standing there and if she'd heard Peter speak. Judging by the way was looking at them, he assumed she had. "Yeah," he replied, shaking himself from his thoughts. When he tried to stand up, Peter gripped his arm tightly enough to give him pause. "I'll be right back, Bud," he assured and when he was released he assumed that was the end of it. But as he moved to stand up, he could feel Peter rapidly tapping his shoulder.
Reponse: Mrs. Braswell smiled and looked between them before taking a slow breath. "Peter, I know you already heard the Stricklands say they would like to have you moved into another home," she said with palpable remorse. "And I'm so sorry you had to hear it like that. I know how much you were hoping that this placement would last until you aged out of the system."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: He was pulled back to the present when Mrs. Braswell announced she needed to go make some phone calls. "I'm only going to the waiting room," she said, "Text me if you need me."
Reponse: He blinked a few times to clear his mind and looked down at Peter. "You should get some more sleep, Pete," he said as he eased the kid down onto the pillows and pulled the sheet all the way up to his chin.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: All of those complex thoughts and the first thing to fall out of Pepper's mouth was, "Tony. We're not even  engaged."
Reponse: "But we could be," Tony replied without missing a beat. "We could get married next week. Peter could be my best man."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "I did. Now I want Peter to be my best man," Tony countered, then waved his hand flippantly through the air, as his face drew into a smirk. "We can make Rhodey the ring bearer."
Reponse: An image of James Rhodes walking down the aisle in his full military uniform while carrying a small lace pillow popped into her head without her permission. It caused her to giggle until her eyes began to water. "I don't think any of these things work the way you think they do," she breathlessly laughed. She wasn't sure if she was referring to a full grown adult performing ring bearer duties the entirety of the conversation that had led up to that moment. Probably both. It didn't matter. It felt like a 'laugh about it or cry about it' kind of situation and she had chosen the former.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "To get married and adopt a kid," Pepper cut in, then faltered for a second or two. "You've always been so-"
Reponse: "Semi-non-committal, I know," Tony admitted in a rush. "But this is different.  I'm different.  I'm ready for this."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "If not us, then who? Where does he go next, Pep?" Tony shot back, the hopefulness of his voice edging on desperation. "He's already been through so many homes and seeing as none of them stuck, I can only assume that they all sucked. We could give him something stable, Pepper. It wouldn't even be that involved. All we'd have to do is keep doing what we've already been doing, right? Just on a more 'round the clock basis."
Reponse: "We don't even know what something like this would require," she replied. "It could take weeks or months to get approved."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Just ignore him," Pepper said with a roll of her eyes. "But we do have a few questions for you, when you have a moment."
Reponse: "Questions regarding Peter, I presume?" Mrs. Braswell asked thoughtfully and Tony perked up.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: Tony felt a bubble of excitement rise in his chest. There wasn't anything she'd listed that he couldn't hand her within the next hour and half. Including the physical exam reports. He could walk to the back and get that taken care of and have the doctor sign off on it in no time at all. "Easy, I can do all of that today," he said, giving Pepper a fleeting happy glance as he eagerly rubbed his hands together.
Reponse: "You would also need fifteen hours of age appropriate Continue Parental Training, beginning with a four hour foster parent preparation course and a three hour Crisis Management course. Of the fifteen total hours, five of them would need to happen in an in person environment. The rest can be done through state approved online classes," Mrs. Braswell added, minutely hampering Tony's zeal. He'd not been planning on having to do any more classes but fifteen hours didn't seem all that bad. He figured the most difficult part would be tracking down and completing the in-person learning in a timely manner.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "You would also need fifteen hours of age appropriate Continue Parental Training, beginning with a four hour foster parent preparation course and a three hour Crisis Management course. Of the fifteen total hours, five of them would need to happen in an in person environment. The rest can be done through state approved online classes," Mrs. Braswell added, minutely hampering Tony's zeal. He'd not been planning on having to do any more classes but fifteen hours didn't seem all that bad. He figured the most difficult part would be tracking down and completing the in-person learning in a timely manner.
Reponse: "I can complete fifteen course hours, no problem. Took more than that my first year at MIT," he said with confidence. Though, in reality he was starting to feel slightly disheartened. He assumed he would need at least three days to get through that many classes, thus lengthening the amount of time it would take to bring Peter home.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Joint," Tony rushed out before Pepper had time to adequately answer. He instantly realized she would have said the same thing. But an impulse had taken over and the word had flown out of his mouth before he could stop it. He smiled softly, apologetically towards Pepper before looking back towards the social worker. "We would want it to be joint."
Reponse: "In that case, yes. Mrs. Potts would have to meet all of the same requirements," Mrs. Braswell said, looking from Tony to Pepper with a satisfied look on her face. Tony wondered what could possibly be going through her head.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "I just want him home," Tony helplessly stated, then wound his fingers between Pepper's. "We just want him home."
Reponse: "I know," Mrs. Braswell said softly. "But In the meantime, I'm going to find him somewhere to go where he can be attended to until we can get everything all worked out."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: Tony smiled sadly towards the social worker who had paused to listen. "That he would miss me if he was moved too far away."
Reponse: "Well, we're not going to let that happen," Pepper replied.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: Tony smiled and pressed his cheek to the top of Pepper's head. "No," he said with a smile. "We're definitely not. We're going to make him ours." silence followed, but it was quickly interrupted by the appearance of a nurse he didn't recognize.
Reponse: "Mr. Stark?" the young man said. "I'm sorry to interrupt, but Peter's awake and asking for you."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "We're not going to change our minds," Tony and Pepper said in relative unison. Tony took a moment to smile at her before turning his attention back to the social worker.
Reponse: "The advice stands, Mr. Stark, Ms. Potts. As you said, he's been through enough."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Trauma can come in many forms but when you strip it down to the very basics what you're looking at is an unexpected, unwanted experience that the child is unprepared to handle and unable to stop. These kinds of experiences turn into trauma when the child's brain and body become so overwhelmed that they can't cope with or process the event that triggered it," the woman said, and Tony's chest began to ache. As much first-hand experience as he had on the subject, hearing it explained to him in regards to Peter made the entire process sound three thousand times worse.
Reponse: "Did you have a question for me?" the woman asked as Tony approached, Pepper close behind him.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Yeah, I just wish I knew when those steps would be taking place," he snapped with enough aggression that he could see Pepper flinch beside him. He squeezed his eyes shut as guilt took over. "I'm sorry, Pep. I'm just-"
Reponse: "-Stressed," Pepper interjected, then added, "I know. Me too," before changing the subject entirely. "Have you heard from Peter today?"
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "-Stressed," Pepper interjected, then added, "I know. Me too," before changing the subject entirely. "Have you heard from Peter today?"
Reponse: "Peter is in a safe place," Mrs. Braswell had assured. "I'm checking in with him on a regular basis and can assure you his needs are being met."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Well in that case," Mrs. Braswell huffed, then paused for dramatics. "I supposed I can let Peter know that you're not available for any visitation this week."
Reponse: "Wait! I'd like to amend my stipulations," Tony frantically responded. He could hear Pepper giggling beside him and glared minutely. He couldn't decide if she was taking pleasure in his mild distress or if she was just as giddy as he was over a potential visit with Peter.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Yeah," he reluctantly conceded, despite a lump that had formed in the back of his throat. "You're right, I know. I just-"
Reponse: "-I know" Mrs. Braswell affirmed and Tony grew quiet, reminding himself that they were all working towards the same thing. Getting Peter into a home where he could thrive.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Sounds absolutely perfect," Tony replied with enthusiasm. "Can't wait to see him," he added. And as the call ended, he glanced wistfully towards Pepper while his fingers drummed out a happy rhythm across the steering wheel.
Reponse: Pepper smiled back and unperturbed pulled her phone out of her bag. "I guess I should email the board members about a reschedule."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: Pepper smiled back and unperturbed pulled her phone out of her bag. "I guess I should email the board members about a reschedule."
Reponse: After that Tony turned the music up and instantly began to sing along while Pepper typed into her phone. Then an impulse took over, and he couldn't stop himself from giddily reaching over to grab her hand and he shouted over the radio, "We're going to see our kid!"
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "I like that plan," Pepper said softly, pausing her gentle ministrations to encourage Peter to look up at her. As he did so he could see her smiling but it wasn't quite reaching her eyes.
Reponse: "I don't ever want to see you in a hospital bed again," she said, then sighed in resignation. "Well, not for a long time anyway. I know we can't prevent you from going out and helping people. And I know that sometimes you're going to get hurt. But if we can teach you how to prevent those kinds of things from happening, I'm all for it."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "I really do," Tony replied. Then he placed a hand on either side of Peter's face and smiled. "Do you trust me?"
Reponse: As Peter nodded his head and sucked in a sharp breath, he felt himself being tugged into a tight embrace. He sank into it, resting his head on Tony's chest while, "Good, boy," was whispered into his ear.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: As Peter nodded his head and sucked in a sharp breath, he felt himself being tugged into a tight embrace. He sank into it, resting his head on Tony's chest while, "Good, boy," was whispered into his ear.
Reponse: "Come on, you two," Pepper quietly prompted. "Why don't you get cleaned up here and join me in the lounge?" she said, then smiled softly. "We have something for you, Peter."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Oh come on, Honeybear. You  know  I know how to cover my tracks," Tony attempted to appease. And to be fair, he had covered his tracks. Just enough to prevent his encrypted message from looking any kind of out of the ordinary.
Reponse: Rhodey sighed, clearly resigned. "What do you require from me this time?" he asked, making Tony grin.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "For court?" Rhodey clipped back, more out of surprise than upset. " What could you have possibly done that didn't make it to the international news networks?"
Reponse: Tony rolled his eyes at the question and scoffed. "It's not for  court!  For the kid," he pressed. "Pepper and I each need a reference letter to go into our foster to adopt file. Pep's already gotten one from her best friend from college.  I was hoping to get one from my best friend from college too," he added. Then, having gotten past the more important part of his request his lips turned upward as he quipped, "I mean don't get me wrong I did consider asking the president. But I figured he had enough on his hands already."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Well, I'll be home in a few weeks and let me tell you, I can't wait to meet the kid that single-handedly managed to domesticate Tony Stark," Rhodey softly replied.
Reponse: Tony chuckled and ran a weary hand down his face. "To be fair, Pepper had a head start on that," he said, but Rhodey was quick to disagree.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Thanks, Rhodey," he replied, his voice laced with genuine gratitude. "You're the best."
Reponse: "Oh, I know," Rhodey happily replied, and that's where the call ended. One step closer to having everything they needed to bring Peter home.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Tony,"  Pepper huffed. "You're pacing again."
Reponse: Tony flung his hands up in the air but didn't pause in his steps. "Well, I don't know what else to do," he snapped. Subsequently he attempted to roll the tension out of his shoulders and took in a deep breath through his nose. "I feel like there should be something else to do."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: Pepper sighed and hauled him by the belt loop onto the couch beside her. "There's not, Tony. We've already done everything they've asked us to do. Now we wait."
Reponse: "Waiting isn't my strong suit, Pep," he grumbled. He simply wasn't used to having to wait on much of anything. Predominantly speaking, things happened in his time, when he was ready. He didn't have to wait. He possessed enough power, money and pull to make sure of it. But none of those things had mattered nearly as much as he would have liked during the foster to adopt process. Sure it had sped up the time it took to get the inspections done and his paperwork had been processed with a bit more urgency that it would have been for anyone else. But he'd still had to go through every single step and each one had slowly chipped away at his patience level. He had very little left to offer.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "I'm going to go check Pete's room. The furniture anchor I installed behind the dresser seemed a little loose yesterday. I should make certain I got it solidly in the stud," he announced. Before he could ascend to his feet, Pepper grabbed hold of his sleeve.
Reponse: "It's fine Tony," she assured. "FRIDAY would have notified you if it wasn't."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "It's fine Tony," she assured. "FRIDAY would have notified you if it wasn't."
Reponse: "Yeah. You're probably right," Tony agreed and went back to bouncing his knees.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Yes, Honey. Yes, you have," Pepper cooed. Subsequently she leaned into Tony's side and placed a hand on his upper thigh. "But that was the last step and that alone is something to celebrate, right?"
Reponse: Even without the suggestive touch, Pepper's tone had immediately grabbed Tony's attention. "What did you have in mind Ms. Potts?" he asked and Pepper leaned in until he could feel her breath ghosting past his ear. From there, she whispered a handful of promises that made his jaw drop and his body tingle with anticipation.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: Meanwhile, Mrs. Braswell joined Peter, placed her hand on his shoulder, and gave it a light squeeze. "You see those two people over there?" she asked, and confusedly, Peter nodded his head. "They just moved heaven and hell to get to you," she gladly expounded. "And that's how I know this is going to work out just fine. I think you're going to be very happy here, Peter."
Reponse: A few scant moments later, Mrs. Braswell walked out the door saying, "I'll be checking in with you all periodically," as she went. Peter knew that was the procedure, but he'd be lying if he said he wasn't at least a little relieved to hear her confirm it. While he was overjoyed to be with Tony and Pepper and knew they would likely end up adopting him, his feelings were complicated. Over the years he'd grown to love Mrs. Braswell and wasn't quite ready for her to exit his life just yet.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Peter," Pepper prompted, transferring his attention to her. "This is your room now. We wanted it to reflect you."
Reponse: Peter nodded and glanced back towards Tony who was grinning. "And I think we managed a pretty okay job if I do say so myself," he said with gusto. Then instantly changed his demeanor to something a little more serious. "However, if there's anything you want to replace or add, just let us know and we'll make it happen. Capisce?"
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Of course, it is," Pepper smiled. "In fact, that's exactly what I was expecting you to say."
Reponse: "Don't be," Pepper said with a smooth wave of her hand. "Knowing you well enough to predict the things you like makes me happy."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Rules? Kid, they're the same as they've always been," Tony said, but that answer was far from placating. Other than a few quick instructions about what he could and couldn't touch in the lab, Tony nor Pepper had ever given him any kind of parameters to work within. That had been okay at the time. He'd never stayed there longer than a day, and what had been expected of him during those stretches of time had been clear. However, his stay was no longer short term, and he didn't know how to express the difference. So he didn't express anything at all. Instead, he sent Tony a pleasing look that he hoped would convey exactly how unsure he felt about everything without having to say it.
Reponse: "Okay," Tony sighed, glancing between Peter and Pepper who had already gotten comfortable in the living room. "Let's uh, How about we take this to the living room, hmm? That way we can sit down and discuss everything that's on your mind. You can ask questions and we can work together to figure this all out, alright?"
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Feeling a little better, Kiddo?" Tony asked softly. Peter nodded his head and half-smiled. Tony nodded too before giving his phone another cursory glance.
Reponse: "As far as chores go, the only person you're responsible for is you. Keep your room clean and relatively organized, put your dishes in the dishwasher, that kind of stuff. That's all we ask," Tony said, his words accompanied by a flippant wave of his hand.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "We have no intention of changing your school," Pepper replied, instantly easing Peter's mind. "Unless of course, you ever decide you want us to."
Reponse: "That's fine, Kiddo. Midtown's a great school," Tony said, then sat back down beside Pepper. "But to answer your first question, yes. You would just come right back up here after school. Or to the lab, if I'm there and you want to join me. Or Pepper's office if you want to be with her. It's really up to you, Kid," Tony suggested. "Unless- would you rather one of us come to pick you up?"
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: Pepper looked happily over her shoulder as she divided a pile of eggs between three plates. "The thing is, Peter. With you living here, people might start getting a few ideas about what kind of information they are and are not entitled to," she said. There was no further explanation while she passed out plates and collected a jug of juice from the refrigerator. When she finally sat down, she looked towards Peter and smiled.
Reponse: "Essentially, we just want to make sure your school is aware that even though we're your legal guardians and we have every intention of adopting you, you're still a foster child. Meaning that your information and image are still sealed to the public."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "Oh, you're welcome to tell whomever you'd like, Kid. But legally speaking, no one should be publishing your picture or personal information. Including us," Tony replied. "When we have to address the media- because we will eventually have to address them- all we plan to say is that we've been given the privilege to bring a outstanding young man into our home, and that we ask for due privacy in the matter until which time we choose to come forward with more information."
Reponse: "I know this is probably a very different situation for you," Pepper gently added. "And probably not one you've ever had to consider before."
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "If you could keep your mouth shut as well as Penis, the world would be a much better place."
Reponse: "Yeah? Well, if you could keep your mouth shut and-" Ned began to retaliate, but Peter caught him by the arm. They were running out of time to get their things together and arguing with Flash never did any good.
title: So Many Things to Say
author: happyaspie

Dialogue: "No. I don't regret a single thing."
Reponse: "You're not even his soulmate. Even though he's yours." Alberu had been too frank back then, still pure of the mess of politics that would later turn his tongue glib.
title: Rumpelstiltskin
author: CloudySonder
fandom: baegjaggayi mangnaniga doeeossda - yuryeohan | Trash of the Count's Family - Yulyeohan

Dialogue: "You'll understand one day, Alberu. It's... indescribable. When you look into their eyes for the first time, you'll see a color that you've never seen before in your life. And then little things will look brighter than usual, and everything starts to make sense, starts to fall into place." His mother brushed a strand of Alberu's hair behind his ear. "It's because of him that I can see how lovely this blue necktie looks on you."
Reponse: "Mom," he'd asked, just like he'd asked every night then, "What does the color red look like?"
title: Rumpelstiltskin
author: CloudySonder
fandom: baegjaggayi mangnaniga doeeossda - yuryeohan | Trash of the Count's Family - Yulyeohan

Dialogue: "Mom," he'd asked, just like he'd asked every night then, "What does the color red look like?"
Reponse: "It's the color of love..."
title: Rumpelstiltskin
author: CloudySonder
fandom: baegjaggayi mangnaniga doeeossda - yuryeohan | Trash of the Count's Family - Yulyeohan

Dialogue: "It's alright, your Highness. I've underlined all the important information in red, so it stands out."
Reponse: "Thank you so much as always, Sir Gentius. Truly, your family's work is the foundation of our country." Alberu pasted on a bright smile. "Have a wonderful day."
title: Rumpelstiltskin
author: CloudySonder
fandom: baegjaggayi mangnaniga doeeossda - yuryeohan | Trash of the Count's Family - Yulyeohan

Dialogue: "...Is that so?" Was he... making fun of Alberu?
Reponse: Henituse's smile took on a more mischievous edge. "Indeed, Your Highness. I may not be able to sleep at night now that I have personally met you, the star of the Roan Kingdom."
title: Rumpelstiltskin
author: CloudySonder
fandom: baegjaggayi mangnaniga doeeossda - yuryeohan | Trash of the Count's Family - Yulyeohan

Dialogue: Cautiously, he ventured, "I feel that Young Master Henituse is similar to me."
Reponse: "Such a compliment is the greatest honor of my life, Your Highness," Henituse replied. Ironclad. No vulnerability, no truth.
title: Rumpelstiltskin
author: CloudySonder
fandom: baegjaggayi mangnaniga doeeossda - yuryeohan | Trash of the Count's Family - Yulyeohan

Dialogue: "...an ancient power," Alberu caught the tail end of Henituse's sentence. He placed his hand on Henituse's shoulder and leaned into his ear.
Reponse: "I see."
title: Rumpelstiltskin
author: CloudySonder
fandom: baegjaggayi mangnaniga doeeossda - yuryeohan | Trash of the Count's Family - Yulyeohan

Dialogue: "I see."
Reponse: "Your Highness." Ah, Alberu was getting used to that calculating gaze.
title: Rumpelstiltskin
author: CloudySonder
fandom: baegjaggayi mangnaniga doeeossda - yuryeohan | Trash of the Count's Family - Yulyeohan

Dialogue: "Young Master Henituse, we are the same, aren't we?" He whispered. "Play along with me, and I'll reward you generously."
Reponse: Henituse raised his voice, "You praise me too generously, Your Highness. I was only doing what any normal citizen would do."
title: Rumpelstiltskin
author: CloudySonder
fandom: baegjaggayi mangnaniga doeeossda - yuryeohan | Trash of the Count's Family - Yulyeohan

Dialogue: "After you, Young Master Henituse," Alberu said, gesturing to the carriage. "You deserve such honor from today forth."
Reponse: "That's quite alright, Your Highness. How could I possibly enter before you?" Henituse bowed, his posture perfect.
title: Rumpelstiltskin
author: CloudySonder
fandom: baegjaggayi mangnaniga doeeossda - yuryeohan | Trash of the Count's Family - Yulyeohan

Dialogue: "Then," Henituse lowered his head in dissent, ever polite, "This lowly self will enter first."
Reponse: "Treat the lady over there well," he whispered to a butler, before climbing the carriage behind Henituse.
title: Rumpelstiltskin
author: CloudySonder
fandom: baegjaggayi mangnaniga doeeossda - yuryeohan | Trash of the Count's Family - Yulyeohan

Dialogue: Alberu huffed at the mocking lilt, "You freezing in place when you met my eyes were a little bit of an indicator."
Reponse: "I thought I dealt with it as well as I could, all things considered," Alberu replied, mock affronted. "Isn't it your fault for being born with eyes in the most vivid shade possible?"
title: Rumpelstiltskin
author: CloudySonder
fandom: baegjaggayi mangnaniga doeeossda - yuryeohan | Trash of the Count's Family - Yulyeohan

Dialogue: Alberu thought. He huffed out a sheepish laugh. "Let's call it that, sure."
Reponse: "You..." Henituse blinked, red eyes piercing through Alberu. "You couldn't have thought the bond was one-sided, could you?"
title: Rumpelstiltskin
author: CloudySonder
fandom: baegjaggayi mangnaniga doeeossda - yuryeohan | Trash of the Count's Family - Yulyeohan

Dialogue: Henituse asked, incredulous. He cleared his throat. "Sorry, habit--"
Reponse: "Oh thank God, we can drop formalities." Alberu sighed, finally relaxing in his seat. Henituse stared at him strangely. "What? We're mature enough to cuss in front of each other, I'm sure."
title: Rumpelstiltskin
author: CloudySonder
fandom: baegjaggayi mangnaniga doeeossda - yuryeohan | Trash of the Count's Family - Yulyeohan

Dialogue: A thrill traveled down Alberu's spine. "You... you're really..." Alberu covered his mouth as he grinned, delighted. "No one's figured me out in two decades, and you've managed it in less than a day."
Reponse: "I could say the same for you." Henituse mirrored Alberu's excitement. "To be fair, I did have a few more clues. I mean, what color do you think I saw when I looked at you?"
title: Rumpelstiltskin
author: CloudySonder
fandom: baegjaggayi mangnaniga doeeossda - yuryeohan | Trash of the Count's Family - Yulyeohan

Dialogue: "I knew you hadn't dyed it with human magic, or it would've faded under the Area, so you probably used dark mana. You weren't a demon, a black mage, or a necromancer, so I figured you were a Dark Elf," Cale explained, ever casual. "I mean, the late Queen was rumored to be a Southerner because of the color of her skin, and halfblood Elves have skin similar to Southerners. So... you're the child of a halfblood elf?"
Reponse: "Correct on all counts," His Highness replied. He took a deep breath in and slowly exhaled, slumping back in his seat. His blonde hair looked like threads of gold against the seats, and Cale stared, mesmerized. "It's such a relief... Ah, I'm glad I don't have to lie to you."
title: Rumpelstiltskin
author: CloudySonder
fandom: baegjaggayi mangnaniga doeeossda - yuryeohan | Trash of the Count's Family - Yulyeohan

Dialogue: "You're pretty finicky for a drunk."
Reponse: "You're pretty cunning for a prince."
title: Rumpelstiltskin
author: CloudySonder
fandom: baegjaggayi mangnaniga doeeossda - yuryeohan | Trash of the Count's Family - Yulyeohan

Dialogue: "Human. Why did you do that?" The baby dragon fluttered around Cale's head, confused. "He was your soulmate."
Reponse: "He's the crown prince."
title: Rumpelstiltskin
author: CloudySonder

Dialogue: "I just need to borrow the bird for a while. You will have him back in two weeks tops, good as new. Scouts honor." Jason's words would be more believable if he kept the sarcasm out of his voice. The voice modulator only does so much to hide it.
Reponse: "Forgive us if we don't take your word for it." M'gann melts out of the wall behind them, Tim pulling up his torso to look at her. There is also the sound of running feet from the hallway. Beast Boy must have summoned his sister and whoever she was with.

Dialogue: "When he came and noticed my everything, he asked what happened. I explained, and he went ballistic. It was so scary. It turns out that Dragon is our little brother's father, who hadn't seen him since he was a baby and didn't even say hello. Of course, that pissed us off. So when he came back to check up on me, we made him talk to our brother, who didn't even care. Luffy didn't even give a shit, but we made Dragon talk to him. He apologized and went on our way."
Reponse: "So you don't like him because Dragon didn't say hi to your brother-yoi?"
title: Brother of mine
author: Dezace

Dialogue: "So you don't like him because Dragon didn't say hi to your brother-yoi?"
Reponse: "You got it in one."

"You can go be self-righteous assholes together, feeling all sorry for poor little me. But you can leave me the hell out of it."

Interesting family business, but it definitely makes me question his fitness as a parent."
Reponse: Clark hummed. "I don't know," he said. "He's so rabid about safety precautions - for everyone except himself, anyway. If he let his kids do something so dangerous, there must have been reasons. We don't have the whole story. Besides," he grimaced, "Red Hood can definitely handle himself."

"It's just-- I suppose I understand if you're too scared to hold my hand. Don't worry, I'll drop it." He places an emphasis on 'scared' that makes Katsuki's teeth grind together painfully.

Dialogue: "Emrys." Merlin looked back, impatient. "There is one other thing the legends say. 'Only when the way ahead seems impossible, will you have found it.'"
Reponse: "Merlin."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Merlin."
Reponse: "Arthur."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "I thought I heard something," Merlin replied, struggling to keep his voice steady. His heart was racing in his throat.
Reponse: Arthur hummed. "Is that so? And did you find what you thought you heard?"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "I--" His voice cracked, and he faltered. Years of hiding, of lying to everyone around him, flooded his mind; memories of countless choices he never wanted to make, mistakes that weighed on him with every step he took. Gaius' scolding words echoing in his ears. The last dragon egg in Albion -- possibly the world -- in danger, because he'd trusted the wrong man.
Reponse: "I did find it, yes. The druids told me that Borden is travelling east. They also gave me a warning that the triskelion leads into a trap. We should be careful." Those last words came out as hardly more than a murmur.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "I did find it, yes. The druids told me that Borden is travelling east. They also gave me a warning that the triskelion leads into a trap. We should be careful." Those last words came out as hardly more than a murmur.
Reponse: "Why would the druids want to help us? And if their intentions truly are honourable, why all this secrecy of meeting in the dead of night?"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Why would the druids want to help us? And if their intentions truly are honourable, why all this secrecy of meeting in the dead of night?"
Reponse: Merlin shrugged. "Borden stole from them too. I doubt they are overly fond of him."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: Merlin shrugged. "Borden stole from them too. I doubt they are overly fond of him."
Reponse: "That doesn't explain why they didn't approach us openly," Arthur insisted. He shook his head. "No, they didn't approach us at all. They knew it was you, specifically, who was coming to meet them. How?"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "They--" Merlin faltered, swallowing around a dry throat. "No-one else would've heard their call."
Reponse: "Why?"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Why?"
Reponse: "No-one else has magic."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "No, gods, no," Arthur said at once, letting out another slightly hysterical laugh as he dropped his hands from his face. He drew a deep breath and turned, meeting Merlin's eyes again. "I didn't know; I never had any confirmation. But I suspected for a while."
Reponse: "Since when?!"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Since when?!"
Reponse: The look Arthur gave him bordered on sheepish. "Since the Dorocha attacked you. Nobody else had survived their touch, not even for a moment. Nobody except you. Somehow you came back from death's door, healthy as though it had never happened, without ever even reaching Camelot to receive Gaius' care." He shook his head a little. "I didn't make the connection immediately. There was still the Cailleach to think about, and then Lancelot... Suffice to say it took mulling it over for a little while before I finally saw the obvious."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "And now? You have your proof; what are you going to do with me?"
Reponse: Arthur's eyebrows jumped up in surprise, before furrowing into a frown. "You don't seriously believe I would execute you, do you?"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: Arthur's eyebrows jumped up in surprise, before furrowing into a frown. "You don't seriously believe I would execute you, do you?"
Reponse: Merlin couldn't help the desperate scoff that escaped him. "With your current attitude towards magic? Hard not to. If you were so upset that I didn't trust you enough to tell you, have you ever stopped to consider why that might've been?"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: Merlin couldn't help the desperate scoff that escaped him. "With your current attitude towards magic? Hard not to. If you were so upset that I didn't trust you enough to tell you, have you ever stopped to consider why that might've been?"
Reponse: Arthur grimaced. "Of course I have."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "It's a dragon," Arthur said incredulously. "Have you forgotten the last time Camelot faced a beast like that? The havoc it wrought? The innocents who died? You being a sorcerer is one thing, but this egg holds a monster waiting to hatch."
Reponse: "--lin! Merlin!" Arthur's hands came to grip Merlin's shoulders without warning, concerned blue eyes suddenly only an arm's length away, boring into him.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Only the dragonlords had such abilities, and there aren't any of those left."
Reponse: "But what if there were," Merlin pressed, holding Arthur's gaze.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "It's not that funny," Arthur grumbled, but he couldn't quite keep the corners of his mouth down either.
Reponse: "Sorry, sorry," Merlin wheezed. "I'm sorry. I'm fine." He struggled to get ahold of himself, sucking in deep breaths as he fought to contain further giggles. "Fine. Okay. I'm fine."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: Sobering quickly, Merlin nodded. "Everything, sire. I promise."
Reponse: "Let's go then, we have a dragon egg to retrieve."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Let's go then, we have a dragon egg to retrieve."
Reponse: Merlin beamed. "Yes, sire."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "There he is!" Elyan exclaimed not ten minutes later, slinging an arm around Merlin's neck to drag him over to where the knights were standing in the banquet hall. "The man of the hour!"
Reponse: "How does it feel, Merlin?" asked Leon.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "How does it feel, Merlin?" asked Leon.
Reponse: Gwaine flagged down a servant, lifted a goblet of wine from her tray, and pushed it into Merlin's hands, before raising his own. "A toast! To finally having a good reason for a feast."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: Gwaine flagged down a servant, lifted a goblet of wine from her tray, and pushed it into Merlin's hands, before raising his own. "A toast! To finally having a good reason for a feast."
Reponse: "To Merlin finally not working during a feast," Elyan added, clinking his goblet against Gwaine's.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "To Merlin finally not working during a feast," Elyan added, clinking his goblet against Gwaine's.
Reponse: "To being who you are without having to hide," said Leon, giving Merlin a warm, genuine smile.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "To being who you are without having to hide," said Leon, giving Merlin a warm, genuine smile.
Reponse: "And to saving our arses without having to hide," Percival finished with a wink.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Hear, hear," came Arthur's voice from behind Merlin, making him jump a little.
Reponse: "To Merlin."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "To Merlin!" the knights echoed.
Reponse: "Well, at least I can use magic now to wash your smelly socks," he quipped, trying to cover up how flustered he was.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: But Arthur shook his head. "Actually, I've decided to dismiss you from your position as my manservant."
Reponse: Merlin's stomach dropped. "What?"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Why?" Merlin croaked, his throat dry as parchment all of a sudden. "I thought we-- You said you--"
Reponse: "You can hardly work two jobs at the same time," Arthur interrupted, and it was the teasing edge to his voice more than his words that made Merlin pause. Arthur heaved an exaggerated sigh. "Did you not listen to the announcement?"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "You can hardly work two jobs at the same time," Arthur interrupted, and it was the teasing edge to his voice more than his words that made Merlin pause. Arthur heaved an exaggerated sigh. "Did you not listen to the announcement?"
Reponse: "Of course I did," Merlin defended. Though, maybe, if he was completely honest, he'd perhaps been a little distracted by the unspeakable feeling of finally being free, and the boundless pride he felt for Arthur.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "You did not hear a single word, did you?" Arthur gave him a mockingly chiding look. "With magic legalised, I need an advisor for magical affairs. The inauguration ceremony for the new Court Sorcerer will be held in a fortnight."
Reponse: Arthur rolled his eyes. "You, Merlin! You're the new Court Sorcerer."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Me?!" Merlin squawked, loud enough that several of the surrounding people turned to give them curious looks. "But I-- I mean I don't-- I'm a servant," he finished lamely.
Reponse: "If I can knight commoners, I can appoint one as Court Sorcerer," replied Arthur smoothly. "Besides, according to Geoffrey, the dragonlords used to be nobility. The council didn't even put up a fight."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "You told them about me?!" Merlin hissed. His magic flared out, dampening their conversation to anyone beyond their circle despite the fact that it was far too late for privacy.
Reponse: "Of course not, idiot. But they agreed wholeheartedly that, should the possibility arise, ensuring the loyalty of a dragonlord would undoubtedly be beneficial for the kingdom." Arthur grinned. "The council meeting tomorrow should be fun."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "So, since we're leaning into the whole dragonlord thing ... are you saying I can hatch the egg?"
Reponse: "Aithusa, drop it! This isn't a toy, for gods' sakes, it's-- Aithusa!" Merlin let a hint of his dragonlord voice seep into the last word.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "You are insufferable," Merlin replied drily.
Reponse: "No, Merlin, he's following court etiquette for once," said Arthur, following Gwaine into Merlin's chambers with a grin. He glanced around the room and raised an eyebrow. "Did you conjure a hurricane in here?"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Such a rush. At least you don't have to deal with George." Arthur laughed when Merlin glared at him. "Let's go then, our horses are ready."
Reponse: Arthur chuckled beside him. "You really would've snapped any second, huh?"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "You have no idea," Merlin groaned, lifting Aithusa from his shoulders and settling her on the saddle in front of him.
Reponse: "The hard life of a lord is getting to you, eh Merlin?"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Ugh." He never should've accepted this bloody title.
Reponse: To Merlin's surprise, Arthur came to his aid. "Leave him be, this trip is supposed to serve as a break, to relax a little."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "I am not most people, Sir Percival, I am your King," Arthur replied promptly, his tone completely serious. This time, it was Leon who failed to suppress his laughter, earning himself a betrayed look from Percival.
Reponse: "What's got you all brooding and serious?" Arthur asked. When it came to dealing with Merlin's moods, he was by far the bravest of the five.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "I'm not brooding. I was just thinking that it's been too long since we went anywhere." He shrugged. "It's nice not to be hounded by council members for a few hours."
Reponse: Leon chuckled. "Missing the good old times?"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: Leon chuckled. "Missing the good old times?"
Reponse: "A little," Merlin admitted with a small smile.

author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "A little," Merlin admitted with a small smile.
Reponse: "Nothing like patrol duty to make you forget that you're nobility now!" Gwaine cheered.
