author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "We'll make camp here," he announced.
Reponse: "Ah, excellent!" Arthur called, approaching Merlin with a grin and clapping a hand on his shoulder. "Since you evidently miss the old times so much, you can cook for us tonight like you used to."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Ah, excellent!" Arthur called, approaching Merlin with a grin and clapping a hand on his shoulder. "Since you evidently miss the old times so much, you can cook for us tonight like you used to."
Reponse: Merlin rolled his eyes. "As if I hadn't done that either way. None of you dolts can cook a decent meal to save your lives."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Come on, I'm famished!" Elyan whined.
Reponse: "It's a mystery to me how you ever survived on your own," Merlin replied. "But you can stop yammering now, it's ready."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "It's a mystery to me how you ever survived on your own," Merlin replied. "But you can stop yammering now, it's ready."
Reponse: "Spoiled, lazy prat," Merlin muttered fondly, rising from his crouch to bring the plate over to Arthur.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Good, you were meant to."
Reponse: "Is that how you address your King, Merlin?"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "What's what?" Leon asked innocently.
Reponse: "Where's the rest?"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Oh, I don't know, my dinner?" Merlin snapped.
Reponse: "Just use your magic," said Gwaine, waving his hand in a dismissive gesture.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Just use your magic," said Gwaine, waving his hand in a dismissive gesture.
Reponse: "Just use my magic," Merlin whispered. "Just. Use. My magic. Of course. Why didn't I think of that? Thank you, Gwaine, for this true stroke of genius. You're as smart as the council!" The knights shied back when he straightened with a hard laugh, watching him wide-eyed. "What a shame the council is full of fools. Let me put this as simply as I possibly can; magic cannot create something out of nothing. It is impossible. Against the laws of nature."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "If I could conjure food out of thin air, or even just crops, do you honestly believe I wouldn't have done so? Do you think I would've let Ealdor starve, my mother starve, year after year, winter after winter? All those famines that plagued Camelot time and again, do you think I would sit idly if it were within my power to help?"
Reponse: "Woah, relax," Gwaine appeased quickly, producing a full plate of stew from behind his pack. "It was just a joke, your share is right here."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Woah, relax," Gwaine appeased quickly, producing a full plate of stew from behind his pack. "It was just a joke, your share is right here."
Reponse: "A joke," Merlin hissed. The air was shimmering with non-existent heat, crackling tension tightening by the second, a matter of time until the last thread snapped. "A joke."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Merlin," Arthur called from behind him, caution heavy as lead in his voice. "They didn't mean anything by it."
Reponse: "Yeah," said Percival, "we were just teasing, like we used to back when--"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Yeah," said Percival, "we were just teasing, like we used to back when--"
Reponse: "When I was still a servant," Merlin cut him off, and the tiny voice drowned under cold fury. "And wasn't that just hilarious, hm? Let's tease Merlin by reminding him he's beneath us, by letting him think he'll go hungry because our wants take precedence over his needs, because we're knights. Never mind that all of you except Leon used to be commoners yourself. How easily you've forgotten what life is like for regular people."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "It was just a joke," Percival muttered, stunned.
Reponse: "We have to find him," said Arthur, already fastening his cloak.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "We have to find him," said Arthur, already fastening his cloak.
Reponse: "I don't think he wants to be found," Leon replied darkly, and Gwaine looked over to where he stood at the edge of the camp with a frown. It took a second before Gwaine realised that Leon's hand was pushing against a near-invisible barrier, only the faintest shimmer of gold crackling like fine lightnings splayed outwards from where Leon touched it.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Gwaine." Leon's hand was gentle but firm on his shoulder as he pulled him away.
Reponse: "This was my idea, my fault, I have to make it right!" Gwaine yelled. The echo of his own words hit him like a bucket of cold water. His idea. His fault. Of course Merlin wouldn't want him to come find him.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "This was my idea, my fault, I have to make it right!" Gwaine yelled. The echo of his own words hit him like a bucket of cold water. His idea. His fault. Of course Merlin wouldn't want him to come find him.
Reponse: "I'll find him," Arthur promised with none of his usual bravado. Only a quiet vow nobody dared to question. He left without another word.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "I never realised Merlin had such a hard life growing up," Leon muttered despondently, dropping down on a fallen tree and lowering his head into his hands.
Reponse: "Neither did I," Elyan agreed.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Did he truly feel-- Did he really think we teased him because we thought ourselves better than him?" Gwaine didn't bother to hide how his voice trembled.
Reponse: "He never said anything," Percival protested, but the desperation in his tone revealed the truth he fought to acknowledge. Yes, that was exactly what Merlin thought.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "It's alright, little one," he lied with a half-hearted smile.
Reponse: "Fine, it will be alright," Merlin amended, earning himself another prodding noise. "I don't know, Aithusa. It's not safe yet, not while my magic is like this."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Arthur," he replied through gritted teeth. His whole body was taut, and he visibly struggled to keep his emotions in check. "You shouldn't be here."
Reponse: Cautiously staying where he was, Arthur did his best to assume their usual teasing tone to reply, "And leave you to sulk in the woods by yourself? I don't think so."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "You don't mean that."
Reponse: The frustrated noise that escaped Merlin's throat was half-growl, half-groan. "I don't want you here, Arthur. Go away."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "You won't hurt me," said Arthur far more confidently than he felt.
Reponse: "I could," Merlin snarled. "I want to."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Then leave!" The shout was accompanied by a gust of wind whipping past them, nearly dislodging Aithusa off Merlin's shoulder.
Reponse: "Ever since we first met, you have faced my temper with stubborn courage. Even when you were the last one to deserve it, you let me vent my anger, again and again, because it may not have been fair but it was what I needed. What sort of friend would I be if I didn't do the same for you?" Slowly, carefully, he inched closer, earning a tiny growl from Aithusa. "I came to apologise, on behalf of the knights as well as myself. It was a tactless prank, and I am sorry for allowing it."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "I don't expect you to understand. You never knew hunger, and bless the gods for that, but them? They should know better. But no. From the moment they knelt before you they were Knights. Respected from the get-go, because they can swing their swords like every other thick-skulled prat son of a noble."
Reponse: "For them it never mattered that they used to be commoners, not in your eyes, not in the court's eyes, not even in their own eyes. They took to it like fish to water. No wonder the common people started being wary of me the moment I became Court Sorcerer -- the knights have shown well enough that it doesn't matter in the slightest whether someone was born noble or not. Once they have a title they're all big-headed pillocks! Except I'm not!"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "I haven't forgotten life as a regular person, I still care! Maybe that's why the whole council looks at me like I'm a pig wandered in from a barn, but if that's the price I pay then so be it."
Reponse: "What do you mean 'the council looks at you like you're a pig'?" he cut in, aghast.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "What do you mean 'the council looks at you like you're a pig'?" he cut in, aghast.
Reponse: "Oh please," Merlin sneered, and the faint shimmer of gold began to drown out the blue of his irises. "Are you telling me you haven't noticed? They hate me, Arthur."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Oh please," Merlin sneered, and the faint shimmer of gold began to drown out the blue of his irises. "Are you telling me you haven't noticed? They hate me, Arthur."
Reponse: "Not all of them, I suppose, but the majority. If you thought I had a knack for turning your titles into insults, you should listen to your esteemed councilmen using mine. They may have accepted my place in court, thanks to Balinor's ancestral line, but they respect me about as much as Uther respected Gwen."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "To them, my upbringing as a rural peasant is an insurmountable obstacle that renders me incapable of offering anything of worth to them. Except the magic, of course. There they expect miracles. Do you know how much of my time in the last two months has been taken up purely by explaining why one ridiculous request after the other is impossible for me to fulfil?"
Reponse: "They want everything, even though they still scrunch up their noses at the mere mention of sorcery like it's something foul. Well, I can't give them what they want!"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "They want everything, even though they still scrunch up their noses at the mere mention of sorcery like it's something foul. Well, I can't give them what they want!"
Reponse: "Their prejudice is proven right day after day, because magic cannot do what they ask me to do, so to them I will always be nothing but a peasant, while the common folk looks at my robes and retreats. It's complete bullshit and I've. Had. Enough!"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "But you didn't," Arthur insisted, reaching for Merlin's shoulder once more to turn him around. "You didn't."
Reponse: "I'm the one who should apologise," Arthur began, his voice soft. "Not just for what happened at the camp, but for a great number of things I apparently failed to notice." He forced himself to meet Merlin's eyes. "Talk to me. Help me to be better, the way you've done since the day we met."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Yes, well, it took a little while before your approach bore fruits," Arthur quipped back, before turning serious again. "It did, though. So help me one more time, Merlin, tell me how to fix this."
Reponse: Merlin's shoulders bowed under invisible weight. "I don't think this is something you can just fix."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: Merlin's shoulders bowed under invisible weight. "I don't think this is something you can just fix."
Reponse: "Maybe not, but I'll be damned if I don't try at least. Please, tell me what's wrong."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Maybe not, but I'll be damned if I don't try at least. Please, tell me what's wrong."
Reponse: "Am I hearing things or did you just say please?"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Are you unhappy as Court Sorcerer?" he asked finally.
Reponse: "No!" Merlin exclaimed. His face fell. "Yes. But that's not--!" He scrunched up his nose and shot Arthur an unhappy glare. "It's more complicated than that."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: Merlin nodded, then winced and shook his head instead. "Yes -- no. It's not just them, though they are prejudiced pricks. It shouldn't matter whether I was born rich or poor. To anyone! But it does, it's like-- It wasn't supposed to be like this."
Reponse: He sighed, voice going quiet. "You repealing the ban was always my silver lining. Even when it was nothing more than a fantasy, it was the one thought that gave me hope, a single ray of light cresting the horizon."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: He sighed, voice going quiet. "You repealing the ban was always my silver lining. Even when it was nothing more than a fantasy, it was the one thought that gave me hope, a single ray of light cresting the horizon."
Reponse: "I thought, you learning the truth would be the hard part. Making you see that magic could be good, convincing you that the ban could be lifted safely and keeping you safe until you got there; that was my destiny. And it happened, magic is free, and I cannot begin to describe how amazing that feels, Arthur, but at the same time ... Nothing is like I thought it'd be."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: Arthur's stomach dropped. His throat was too dry, his voice hoarse as he managed to ask, "What? What do you mean by that?"
Reponse: "Haven't you noticed? I suppose you wouldn't have," Merlin replied, his eyes turning painfully sad. "Ever since you lifted the ban we hardly even see each other. You have your duties as King, I have my duties as Court Sorcerer, and every free minute either of us has is filled with more things to do, more problems to solve, requests to fulfil. And I get that those things are important, that they take precedence, but I--" He broke off and shook his head.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "But I miss you. I miss us and the way we had each other's back."
Reponse: "Being Court Sorcerer and helping to bring magic back to Camelot should feel like a victory, but it doesn't," Merlin went on, oblivious to Arthur's inner turmoil. "Not if I'm doing it without you." He gave Arthur a sad smile. "I just-- I thought we would do this together."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Being Court Sorcerer and helping to bring magic back to Camelot should feel like a victory, but it doesn't," Merlin went on, oblivious to Arthur's inner turmoil. "Not if I'm doing it without you." He gave Arthur a sad smile. "I just-- I thought we would do this together."
Reponse: "We do, Merlin, we will," he rasped. "Gods, I miss you too. All the time, I keep turning around to tell you something and you're not there."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "We do, Merlin, we will," he rasped. "Gods, I miss you too. All the time, I keep turning around to tell you something and you're not there."
Reponse: "You're right," Arthur went on. "Things haven't been going the way they should have. I'm sorry  if I made you feel like you were on your own. I wanted to give you space to settle into your new position, to make your own choices without me hovering over your shoulder." He squeezed him tighter, then drew an arm's length away, keeping his hands on Merlin's shoulders. "You are the most independent person I know, and after everything you've done for me I wanted to leave no doubt for anyone that I trust you completely. Because I do trust you completely, you know that, right?"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "No, Merlin, I mean it. How could you ever think that I wouldn't notice every second of your absence? You have been by my side for more than five years, and despite your absolutely insufferable incompetence as a servant, I have come to rely on you for far more important things than clean armour."
Reponse: "Shouldn't you be the one telling me that I wouldn't make it a day without you? Because you were right, I've missed you by my side from the moment you weren't with me day in day out. You're--" The words got stuck in his throat. Was this really worth the risk? What if he ruined everything with it?
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "I never thought--"
Reponse: "Well, you're an idiot," Arthur cut him off, pressing another kiss to his lips -- brief and actually chaste this time.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Prat," Merlin shot back.
Reponse: "We'll get there, Merlin," Arthur said, voice soft. "We'll reach that horizon of yours, I promise. Together."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Are you ready to go back?" he asked, keeping his tone as light as he could. The knights were probably losing their minds, confined at camp by Merlin's barrier.
Reponse: "We can stay here a little longer if you want," Arthur offered, brushing a strand of hair out of Merlin's eyes. "Or take a midnight stroll, talk some more, just the two of us."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "No, we should go," Merlin finally sighed. Tension seeped back into his shoulders as he got to his feet and called for Aithusa, who came scurrying over to them at once.
Reponse: Arthur took Merlin's hand, lacing their fingers together. "It will be fine."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: Arthur took Merlin's hand, lacing their fingers together. "It will be fine."
Reponse: "Looks like she's forgiven you," said Merlin with a soft smile while Aithusa settled back around his shoulders.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Looks like she's forgiven you," said Merlin with a soft smile while Aithusa settled back around his shoulders.
Reponse: Arthur squeezed his hand. "Just you wait, I'll be her favourite before you know it."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: Arthur shrugged. "It let me."
Reponse: "It let you," Merlin repeated under his breath, furrowing his brows. In all honesty, it wasn't all that surprising. His magic had always reacted different where Arthur was concerned, a curiosity Merlin had always ascribed to their shared destiny. Though, maybe, his own feelings played into it as well. Just a little. At the very least, this little quirk of his magic had kept Arthur safe throughout his earlier outburst, so Merlin decided to simply be grateful and not dwell on it.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "You don't have to talk to them if you don't want to," murmured Arthur, stepping into Merlin's space to run a soothing touch along his cheek.
Reponse: "Don't I?" Merlin's voice was sharp with sarcasm.
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "At least let me apologise, please. Afterwards you won't ever have to speak to me again, I know it doesn't change anything and I swear I won't bother you, but--"
Reponse: "Woah, hang on!" Merlin interrupted, taken aback by Gwaine's vehemence. "Why would I never speak to you again?"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Woah, hang on!" Merlin interrupted, taken aback by Gwaine's vehemence. "Why would I never speak to you again?"
Reponse: Gwaine wrung his hands. "I fucked up. And I'm so sorry, Merlin. You're right, I should've known better, but I fucked up and I understand if you're tired of my bullshit--"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Stop, Gwaine, stop!" Merlin shouted, throwing up his hands, palms out. "What the hell are you on about?! Yes, you fucked up, and I'm bloody well pissed at you -- all of you -- but that doesn't mean I'll never speak to you again!"
Reponse: Heaving a sigh, Merlin dropped his hands and shook his head. "If you think you can just quit being my friend to get off the hook about this, you are sorely mistaken."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "No, that's not--"
Reponse: "Well then stop assuming things, you pillock," Merlin snapped. "Or do you truly think so little of me, that I would end our friendship over you being an inconsiderate pillock? That I'll never speak to any of you ever again?" He glared at each of them in turn. "You're my friends. And by the gods, you are absolute idiots and half the time I wonder why I put up with any of you, but you're still my friends. Now sit your stupid arse down so we can talk about this like adults."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "We figured as much," said Percival, sounding far too small for a man of his size. "Even then, you kept us safe. Thank you."
Reponse: "We're sorry, Merlin. Truly. The prank we played was tactless and inconsiderate. I am ashamed to admit that I never paused to consider whether it could be offensive." He bowed his head. "Whether I grew up with the comforts of nobility or not, as a knight I am sworn to serve all of Camelot's people and it is my duty to aid them in their hardships even if I was fortunate enough to never experience them. I failed you in this."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "We're sorry, Merlin. Truly. The prank we played was tactless and inconsiderate. I am ashamed to admit that I never paused to consider whether it could be offensive." He bowed his head. "Whether I grew up with the comforts of nobility or not, as a knight I am sworn to serve all of Camelot's people and it is my duty to aid them in their hardships even if I was fortunate enough to never experience them. I failed you in this."
Reponse: "We all did," Percival added. "And you were right, we should've known better, but we didn't think."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "When I was still a servant," Merlin finished for him, watching all four of them wince with bitter satisfaction. "Still factually beneath you."
Reponse: "Yeah," Percival muttered. "We never should have abused our higher standing like that. You were always our friend, Merlin, you were my friend before I ever became a knight. We should've treated you better. We should have realised what lines we were crossing with our teasing, but we didn't. There is no excuse. We are sorry."
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "Yeah," Percival muttered. "We never should have abused our higher standing like that. You were always our friend, Merlin, you were my friend before I ever became a knight. Reponse: "Gwaine?"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds

Dialogue: "No! Fuck, no, don't--" Gwaine ran a hand through his hair. "I don't know what to say! Everything they said, except I knew these things! The prank was my idea, and you're my best friend, and I should've realised--"
Reponse: "Yes!" Merlin yelled. "Yes, you should've realised. Yes, it was a shit idea. We can all agree the situation is overall suboptimal. Now stop whining and be better. You expected me to give up on you not two days after we met. I didn't. I never did, so don't you dare to walk out on me, you thick-headed idiot!"
title: Horizons Over Battlegrounds
author: Zaharya

Dialogue: "What's up, loser?" Laura crows as she slams into the boys' bathrooms. Derek scowls at her in the mirror.
Reponse: "I think you're the loser right now seeing as you're lost. The girls' bathroom is across the hall, dumbass."
title: Noteworthy Observations
author: LadyDrace

Dialogue: "I think you're the loser right now seeing as you're lost. The girls' bathroom is across the hall, dumbass."

Dialogue: Derek stops fiddling with his hair, and turns around to glare at her. "None of your business."

Dialogue: "Excuse me," a sweet, if somewhat snippy, voice chirps behind him. "You're blocking my locker."
Reponse: "Oh, sorry." He moves away and lets the girl get her things. He knows her, vaguely. She's a junior, and her name is... Libby? Or something? All he knows about her is that his locker was hers the year before, but that she somehow managed to make the administration switch them. Possibly because of the unholy screech it made the first time he opened it, but he'd just asked the janitor to borrow some oil for the hinges and fixed it. But, then again, from what he can guess about Libby, she doesn't seem the type to be caught within five miles of an oil can. And she also does not seem the type to be very patient with anyone, despite the sweetness of her voice.
title: Noteworthy Observations
author: LadyDrace

Dialogue: "Hey! Wait a second!"
Reponse: The boy turns around, confused. "Uhhh... sure, what's up?"
title: Noteworthy Observations
author: LadyDrace

Dialogue: The boy turns around, confused. "Uhhh... sure, what's up?"
Reponse: "Is this some kind of joke?" Derek blurts, because nothing makes sense. The boy was caught in the act! Either he has the best poker face known to man -which Derek doubts, because it looks like a very expressive face- or there's something else going on here.
title: Noteworthy Observations

Dialogue: "Is this some kind of joke?" Derek blurts, because nothing makes sense. The boy was caught in the act! Either he has the best poker face known to man -which Derek doubts, because it looks like a very expressive face- or there's something else going on here.

Reponse: "You...don't like how you look?" She frowned, scooting closer to him.
title: Five times Tim didn't show up in a photo (and one time he did. Kinda.)
author: KathyKomments (Tht0neGal666)
fandom: Batman - All Media Types,Red Robin (Comics),Robin (Comics),Batgirl (Comics),Addams Family - All Media Types

Dialogue: "You...don't like how you look?" She frowned, scooting closer to him.
Reponse: "Its not that." He shrugged, leaning his head on his shoulder and picking up his camera. The sunset was beautiful. from the right angle, on nights especially cloudy, it made the sky look like it was on fire. He took a picture, inspecting and then storing the instant-print photo. He generally preferred to develop the film, but he wouldn't have time to tonight. "I just...I dunno how to explain it. I just get all anxious when I see myself. Like it isn't quite right yet? Maybe like dysphoria, but not bad?"
title: Five times Tim didn't show up in a photo (and one time he did. Kinda.)

Maybe like dysphoria, but not bad?"

title: Five times Tim didn't show up in a photo (and one time he did. Kinda.)
author: KathyKomments (Tht0neGal666)
fandom: Batman - All Media Types,Red Robin (Comics),Robin (Comics),Batgirl (Comics),Addams Family - All Media Types

Dialogue: "Hm." She sighed, fiddling with the strings on his hoodie silently. he caught their reflection in a surprisingly reflective window. "I don't think I get it." She admitted. "Why do you like taking pictures?"
Reponse: Tim perked up a little at the question, having to go very still to stop from any major appearance changes, but unable to stop freckles from rippling across his skin. A voice that sounded an awful lot like his mother chided him about getting too comfortable. "Because I....I need to, I guess." He whispered, face heating up, and was suddenly glad Cass wasn't in position to see his face. It didn't really matter, because she was cass and they were sitting shoulder to shoulder, so she could absolutely tell anyway, but. Still. "It's like....Its hard to remember why I do all this, sometimes. Why the- the hurt and death and struggle is worth it. And it's because of the little things. The sunsets, the small kindnesses people do when they think no one is looking. It's about the smile that Dick only has around us, and the coffee stains Bruce doesn't notice on his shirts in the morning, and the tender way Damian looks at his cat, and how at peace you look when you dance, and the light shining through Steph's hair and into her eyes when she laughs-" He melts into her side a little more, smile twisting his face so much its also a little embarrassing. Cass holds him tighter.
title: Five times Tim didn't show up in a photo (and one time he did. Kinda.)
author: KathyKomments (Tht0neGal666)
fandom: Batman - All Media Types,Red Robin (Comics),Robin (Comics),Batgirl (Comics),Addams Family - All Media Types

Dialogue: Tim perked up a little at the question, having to go very still to stop from any major appearance changes, but unable to stop freckles from rippling across his skin. A voice that sounded an awful lot like his mother chided him about getting too comfortable. "Because I....I need to, I guess." He whispered, face heating up, and was suddenly glad Cass wasn't in position to see his face. It didn't really matter, because she was cass and they were sitting shoulder to shoulder, so she could absolutely tell anyway, but. Still. "It's like....Its hard to remember why I do all this, sometimes. Why the- the hurt and death and struggle is worth it. And it's because of the little things. The sunsets, the small kindnesses people do when they think no one is looking. It's about the smile that Dick only has around us, and the coffee stains Bruce doesn't notice on his shirts in the morning, and the tender way Damian looks at his cat, and how at peace you look when you dance, and the light shining through Steph's hair and into her eyes when she laughs-" He melts into her side a little more, smile twisting his face so much its also a little embarrassing. Cass holds him tighter.
Reponse: "That's a good reason." She nods eventually, and the reassurance uncoils a nervousness he didn't even know he felt. "It's....There's so much bad. It's important to remember the good. Pictures are a good way. Very clever. But...." She pauses, unsure, a emotion Tim rarely hears from his sister. "You...you are part of the good, too. You should remember yourself, not just everyone else."
title: Five times Tim didn't show up in a photo (and one time he did. Kinda.)
author: KathyKomments (Tht0neGal666)
fandom: Batman - All Media Types,Red Robin (Comics),Robin (Comics),Batgirl (Comics),Addams Family - All Media Types

Dialogue: "That's a good reason." She nods eventually, and the reassurance uncoils a nervousness he didn't even know he felt. "It's....There's so much bad. It's important to remember the good. Pictures are a good way. Very clever. But...." She pauses, unsure, a emotion Tim rarely hears from his sister. "You...you are part of the good, too. You should remember yourself, not just everyone else."
Reponse: "I do." He promises, gently passing the photo to her. she lifts her head a bit to look at it, and he kisses the side of her head. "I do. But memory is a fickle thing, and I want to make sure I have and remember everything and everyone else. I always have myself, for better or for worse."
title: Five times Tim didn't show up in a photo (and one time he did. Kinda.)
author: KathyKomments (Tht0neGal666)
fandom: Batman - All Media Types,Red Robin (Comics),Robin (Comics),Batgirl (Comics),Addams Family - All Media Types

Dialogue: "I do." He promises, gently passing the photo to her. she lifts her head a bit to look at it, and he kisses the side of her head. "I do. But memory is a fickle thing, and I want to make sure I have and remember everything and everyone else. I always have myself, for better or for worse."
Reponse: "For better." She declares firmly, touching the photo softly a she looked at it. "Definitely for better. but you always have us, too. You always have me." She tried to pass the photo back after a moment, but even he could see the reluctance. He shook his head and pushed it back to her.
title: Five times Tim didn't show up in a photo (and one time he did. Kinda.)
author: KathyKomments (Tht0neGal666)
fandom: Batman - All Media Types,Red Robin (Comics),Robin (Comics),Batgirl (Comics),Addams Family - All Media Types

Dialogue: "For better." She declares firmly, touching the photo softly a she looked at it. "Definitely for better. but you always have us, too. You always have me." She tried to pass the photo back after a moment, but even he could see the reluctance. He shook his head and pushed it back to her.
Reponse: "You can't promise that." He said, not scornful or mocking, just tired. He was...He was so tired of people dying. Seances didn't work with just one person, but he only had himself in Gotham, and he couldn't talk to his family about it-either of them- because they wouldn't understand. They couldn't understand the balance he had to keep, between Addams and Drake and Wayne and Bat.
title: Five times Tim didn't show up in a photo (and one time he did. Kinda.)
author: KathyKomments (Tht0neGal666)
fandom: Batman - All Media Types,Red Robin (Comics),Robin (Comics),Batgirl (Comics),Addams Family - All Media Types

Dialogue: "I...can't." Cass admitted, words so quiet they're almost swallowed by the wind, but he hears her. He always hears her. "I can't promise. But I'm going to anyway."
Reponse: "Okay." He sighs. In his head, Aunt Morticia's voice whispers Family is everything, Timothy. Choose wisely. "Okay. Thanks, Cass."
title: Five times Tim didn't show up in a photo (and one time he did. Kinda.)
author: KathyKomments (Tht0neGal666)

Dialogue: "Okay." He sighs. In his head, Aunt Morticia's voice whispers Family is everything, Timothy. Choose wisely. "Okay. Thanks, Cass."
Reponse: "Anything for my little brother." She teases lightly, starting to play with his hair.

Dialogue: "Drake." The demon brat trills, sounding some variation of pleased with himself, which was almost always much worse then when he was straight up angry at Tim. At least anger could be manipulated or misdirected. That mocking tone was generally just something Tim had to ride out and remind himself that Damian, despite how he acts, is not one of his cousins, and Tim retaliating will lead to at best suspicion and at worst a maimed or dead child. He couldn't just cut the kids fingers off and scatter them in the backyard to keep him busy for a few hours, and he couldn't even challenge him to a duel because the kid was insane and would kill him and then Tim would have to explain why he wasn't dead.
Reponse: "Damian." He nods, not looking at the boy. It was like all those stupid anti-bullying assemblies said in middle school- sometimes, not reacting makes the kid angry or bored, because, for all his training and lethality, he's also still, like, 11, so basic stuff like that worked on him.
title: Five times Tim didn't show up in a photo (and one time he did. Kinda.)
author: KathyKomments (Tht0neGal666)
fandom: Batman - All Media Types,Red Robin (Comics),Robin (Comics),Batgirl (Comics),Addams Family - All Media Types

Dialogue: "Damian." He nods, not looking at the boy. It was like all those stupid anti-bullying assemblies said in middle school- sometimes, not reacting makes the kid angry or bored, because, for all his training and lethality, he's also still, like, 11, so basic stuff like that worked on him.
Reponse: "I have realized something, recently." He said leadingly. Tim cut a paragraph of his report and pasted it further down to reincorporate later; it was too opinionated to be in the report proper.

Dialogue: "I have realized something, recently." He said leadingly. Tim cut a paragraph of his report and pasted it further down to reincorporate later; it was too opinionated to be in the report proper.
Reponse: "You're a smart kid. I'd hope you realize a few things, every once in a while." Tim shrugged. He didn't look, but he could still see the kid's face twitch with annoyance, then continue as if he hadn't heard. Admittedly funny in it's own right, but not what he was hoping for.
title: Five times Tim didn't show up in a photo (and one time he did. Kinda.)

fandom: Batman - All Media Types,Red Robin (Comics),Robin (Comics),Batgirl (Comics),Addams Family - All Media Types

Dialogue: "Your point?" Tim shrugged, pursing his lips and trying to keep his brain focused on this report. If he got distracted, he would not refocus on this in a timely manner. Or, in all likelihood, at all.
Reponse: "My point, Drake, is that I cannot help but notice your lack of presence in any of them." The boy drawls smugly. "I checked thoroughly, and you don't appear once. It seems that father can't bear to look at you more then he absolutely must." Damian hissed with sadistic glee.
title: Five times Tim didn't show up in a photo (and one time he did. Kinda.)

Reponse: Tim resigned himself to distraction and saved his work as a draft, finally turning to look at the kid with a raised eyebrow. He probably wouldn't forget about it for too long- Tam would bully him into finishing it eventually. "Hate to break it to you," He lied, "but I took most of those photos myself. Besides, Alfred is rarely in photos like that either." He yawned, stretching his arms and feeling his bones pop more noisily then is probably normal. It was probably fine.

Dialogue: "What do you need, Damian?" Gordon's voice called from inside the room, and Cain moved aside to let him in. He walked in to stand behind Gordon, but kept Cain in his peripherals as best he could anyway. Just in case.
Reponse: "It's about Drake." He said plainly, watching the redhead closely, and there. She went tense, and her expression went cold, and he knew she didn't trust Drake either. Or, at least, knew more then any of the fools that took him at face value for whatever reason.

Reponse: "He's on his way back. I'm following him." She reassured, almost too perfectly timed with the little message being marked as Read.

Dialogue: Steph sighed, making an annoyed sound he could tell she'd been holding back for a while. "Dick. Darling. Dude. All due respect, this is Tim." Steph emphasized, almost offended. "I know Tim better then I know the days of the week and the colors in the rainbow. He'll live, and he'll get over it, and he deserves it." She hissed, offense fading back into her incenced tirade that was, admittedly, getting more tempting by the word.
Reponse: "It is a good plan." He tells her, because she deserves to hear things like that more often, and because it's mostly true. "And it does sound fun." He admitted, excitement starting to build. Shedding his earlier concern, it could be a half decent bonding exercise, even.

Dialogue: "Sorcery is not a matter to be taken lightly," Uther says sternly, "what possible reason could they have for lying?"

Dialogue: "How would I know, Father?" His voice is emotionless. "How would I know, is that what you're asking me?"

title: And I'll Keep It

Dialogue: "I know because I was raised in a household where every mention of magic was met with seething hatred. I know," he continues, still walking, "because when I was growing up that was the only thing I knew would make you happy, if I spoke out about how much I hated magic."
Reponse: "I know because when I was fifteen," he whispers, his voice still carrying throughout the room, "I led a raid on a Druid camp because I thought it was right."
title: And I'll Keep It

Dialogue: "I know because when I was fifteen," he whispers, his voice still carrying throughout the room, "I led a raid on a Druid camp because I thought it was right."
Reponse: "I know because I watched knights of Camelot, men I had been led to believe were good and noble, slaughter men, women, and children like they were sport." Arthur's lips curl up in a horrible sneer. "I know because not once did the Druids fight back, even with all their magic. Not once."
title: And I'll Keep It
author: TheAsexualofSpades

Dialogue: "I know because when I close my eyes I can still hear the screams," Arthur murmurs, "though I'm sure I don't hear nearly as many as you should."
Reponse: "I will not have the blood of another innocent life on my hands," Arthur says, making them all jump as he turns his back on Uther, "not again. Never again."

Dialogue: "I will not have the blood of another innocent life on my hands," Arthur says, making them all jump as he turns his back on Uther, "not again. Never again."

Dialogue: "Fuck, fuck, fuck,  fuck!"  Crowley slammed his hands down onto the surface of the desk. Without a body, it wasn't quite as satisfying a sensation as it should've been. "I don't need this, I  really  don't need  this  , I had  dinner plans, for someone's bloody sake--"

Dialogue: "Good lad," muttered Crowley. "Always knew he had it in him." He looked over at the demon's desk, which was covered in heaps of papers that Crowley recognized with a twinge of sympathetic nausea as Hell Entry Form 84-Q (for souls damned due to sins falling under Category 7DS-3, "lust").

Dialogue: "What have I got? What have I  got?  " Crowley hissed. He could feel the beginnings of a rant bubbling up in his currently nonexistent chest. He hadn't stopped the Apocalypse with his own two hands3 just to end up back  here,  where Aziraphale  wasn't, to hear his beloved Earth dissed by some junior clerk who wouldn't know a good time if it took a creepshot up her big fluffy skirt.

Dialogue: "Wouldn't have worked," Mr. Kovensky said, as he carefully scraped the dried blood off of the fender of his large black car into a small glass container. "It would've sensed the intent. I told you, doing it with the car was the simplest and cleanest way. The element of surprise is everything, with creatures like that. Can't give them long enough to play their tricks."
Reponse: "How long till we can go get him?" Cyn was sitting in the passenger seat, kicking her legs idly out of the open door as she watched her father collect his occult sample. She was twelve years old and had none of the haunted solemnity one type of person might expect of a small girl reared at a funeral home, nor the sprightly, protagonistic spunk another type of person might expect. To her father's dismay, Cyn had been blessed with a quality her teachers at school had described as being "bang on average." She was the second-most-normal child in her grade. She had mousy brown hair and mousy brown eyes and regarded her father's cabalistic hobbies with reflexive skepticism.

A large Grecian amphora, 6th century BC if Aziraphale's eyes didn't deceive him (and they never did), depicting a man that could only be Crowley, lounging amongst grapevines, playing a lyre.

Dialogue: "I wouldn't dare, my dear," said Aziraphale kindly, even though his fingers itched at that very moment to brush themselves along the metal frame of the filing cabinets, open them up and then dig deep inside. He'd not saved any of his letters from Crowley, over the years-- it was simply too dangerous to keep them around. But Crowley had always been freer from those kinds of qualms, and a fervent hope was stirring inside Aziraphale that if he could just take a look, he'd see his own words speaking back to him, out of the past.
Reponse: "The Codex Catabascum is in one of the boxes in the back, should be, ah, the far right corner. Necromancy is in with the other demonic texts."

Dialogue: "Two Robins?!" Robin looked in awe, "Wow, now that's a thought."
Reponse: "I'm sorry?" La'gaan asked. He didn't look sorry.
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "I'm sorry?" La'gaan asked. He didn't look sorry.
Reponse: "There have been five Robins," Red Hood explained after a moment, "Six if you count that new kid. But that whole thing was kinda weird."
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "There have been five Robins," Red Hood explained after a moment, "Six if you count that new kid. But that whole thing was kinda weird."
Reponse: "Six?!" several people announced, and looked at Batman, who nodded.
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "Six?!" several people announced, and looked at Batman, who nodded.
Reponse: "How come we've never met them?" M'gann asked, "Nightwing, how could you not have told us?"
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "How come we've never met them?" M'gann asked, "Nightwing, how could you not have told us?"
Reponse: "You haven't met them 'cause most of the bats stick to Gotham," Robin answered, "there hasn't a need to drag everyone up here. Let alone the Robins."
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "You haven't met them 'cause most of the bats stick to Gotham," Robin answered, "there hasn't a need to drag everyone up here. Let alone the Robins."
Reponse: "Wait," Zattanna said, "There are more bats?"
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "Wait," Zattanna said, "There are more bats?"
Reponse: NIghtwing laughed again. "Oh boy, you guys really know nothing? Do any of you pay attention to Gotham?" There were several sheepish smirks, and Nightwing sighed. "Artemis is the only one who actually gets this, isn't she?"
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: Jason frowned. "I wish she was here today, I wanted to say high." he then looked at the still confused faces of the hero community. He stood up dramatically, as if about to start a grand speech."Okay, rundown. You know Batman, obviously. Dicky-bird over there was the first Robin. I was the second. Then you have Timbo who was the third-"
Reponse: "Was?" several people asked.
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "Was?" several people asked.
Reponse: "I still go by Robin up here 'cause it's easier-"
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "Yup!" Nightwing announced, drawing attention onto him. "And the kid's a cutie!"
Reponse: Tim scoffed. "That's not half the bats though," he pointed out. "You have Batwoman, Batwing ... hey, Azrael counts, right?"
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "I mean," Dick said, "He was Batman at one point, and lives in Gotham so yeah. He'd probably not want to be called that though."
Reponse: Jason laughed. "He and Leslie think we're all crazy. I mean, they're right, but still."
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: Batman frowned. "I don't have favor-"
Reponse: "You do." All three former Robins said in unison.
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "You do." All three former Robins said in unison.
Reponse: "So yeah," Dick continued, "She's awesome. Easily kicks our butts - including B! But after her you have Spoiler, the third Batgirl, and fourth Robin. After her there's Catwoman -" there were several gasps. "Oh yeah, she and Bats are totally a thing - have been for years. You wouldn't be surprised if you saw their flirting! There was this one time when I was Robin, I was supposed to case a building while B went after Cat, right? Well when i got there, they were already half-"
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "So yeah," Dick continued, "She's awesome. Easily kicks our butts - including B! But after her you have Spoiler, the third Batgirl, and fourth Robin. After her there's Catwoman -" there were several gasps. "Oh yeah, she and Bats are totally a thing - have been for years. You wouldn't be surprised if you saw their flirting! There was this one time when I was Robin, I was supposed to case a building while B went after Cat, right? Well when i got there, they were already half-"
Reponse: "That's enough." Batman growled, and Nightwing grinned.
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "That's enough." Batman growled, and Nightwing grinned.
Reponse: "Moving on!" Jason announced, "since we all have horrible memories of batcat freaky roof time, you have Huntress, and Blue Bird. Then The Signal - he was kinda a half Robin, in a gang war sort of way. But that's not important. He's the only meta protege of batsy's, and if that doesn't scream second favorite child, I don't know what does!"
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "Moving on!" Jason announced, "since we all have horrible memories of batcat freaky roof time, you have Huntress, and Blue Bird. Then The Signal - he was kinda a half Robin, in a gang war sort of way. But that's not important. He's the only meta protege of batsy's, and if that doesn't scream second favorite child, I don't know what does!"
Reponse: "You allow metas in Gotham now?!" Garfield asked.
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "No." all the bats announced in unison.
Reponse: "Signal is the exception, and if you met him, you'd understand. Easily the sanest out of all of us." Jason explained with a wink.
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "None of this explains why we haven't met these people!" Connor said.
Reponse: Batman sighed heavily. "Fine. I'll set up a meeting, check out who's in town and such. Not today though, there's a drug bust going down and no one's available. Besides, they don't even know what's going on up here."
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: Batman sighed heavily. "Fine. I'll set up a meeting, check out who's in town and such. Not today though, there's a drug bust going down and no one's available. Besides, they don't even know what's going on up here."
Reponse: "Jason." Batman growled in warning.
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "Jason." Batman growled in warning.
Reponse: "I'm sorry, B!" Jason said, despite looking more along the lines of gleeful. "Blondie asked what I was doing today, and you know how hard it is to lie to her!"
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: Batman groaned - honest to gosh groaned! - and pinched the bridge of his nose. "She's on her way right now, isn't she?"
Reponse: Jason shrugged. "She said something about grabbing snacks."
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: Jason shrugged. "She said something about grabbing snacks."
Reponse: Tim groaned. "We're all dead."
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: Tim groaned. "We're all dead."
Reponse: "What's going on?" M'gann asked, "Why would this be bad?"
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "What's going on?" M'gann asked, "Why would this be bad?"
Reponse: Dick sighed. "Spoiler is just ... special."
title: Code Orange (Batfam/Young Justice Crossover)
author: PepperSoniRoni

Dialogue: "First mention of him was two months ago, a month after Hassan's death. First we speculated if he was one of the missing allies, but as you can see, they are all there in the picture with him."
Reponse: "So we've got no clue who Birdman is?" Soap asked.
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Negative. All we know is that he is very ready to fill the space Hassan left behind," Laswell tightened her lips. "And we have to stop that from happening."
Reponse: "We've located their hideout. It seems they've bunkered down in some tunnels, making it practically impossible to get any images or plans of the layout. We only have some old maps detailing how the tunnels used to look before the group settled. We have no clue if they've dug out new paths, or where they've set up main operations inside."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "We've located their hideout. It seems they've bunkered down in some tunnels, making it practically impossible to get any images or plans of the layout. We only have some old maps detailing how the tunnels used to look before the group settled. We have no clue if they've dug out new paths, or where they've set up main operations inside."
Reponse: "Wait, so we're going in blind?" Gaz exclaimed, leaning forward with a nervous expression.
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "You speak English?" Price questioned the man on the ground in a low tone. The question received a quick nod in response, the man's eyes never moving from Ghost.
Reponse: "You make any noise to alert your comrades, my friend here will slit your throat." Price's voice was practical as if he wasn't threatening someone's life. "Got that?"
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "We have to go. Now." Soap's shaky voice sounded loud after being so careful to make no noise, but he didn't care.
Reponse: "MacTavish?" Price asked at the same time as Ghost uttered a concerned "Johnny?"
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Ghost?" he coughed, crawling close to the big man. Johnny hung his head in relief when his fingers found a strong pulse right under the balaclava.
Reponse: "MacTavish, how copy?" Soap almost jumped at the deep voice crackling to life in his ear. How had he forgotten the comms?
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Had to pull me and Gaz backwards when everything collapsed. Saw the ceiling comin' straight at us."
Reponse: "Soap?"
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Thought you said just bruises? How's the head, sergeant?" The captain's voice was laced with concern again.
Reponse: "Ah," he mumbled.
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Maybe a slight concussion, captain." Price cursed vehemently in his ear, and the sergeant hurried to calm the older man: "Very slight. I still remember everything and am able to move around just fine." Except anything that agitated his stomach. "Jus' a bit out of it."
Reponse: "Alright, okay." Soap could tell the captain was scrambling to keep control. "You said you could move Riley's arm free?"
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Any items close to you that could fill the spot when his arm is out?"
Reponse: "Indiana Jones style swap, sir?" For the first time since he woke, Johnny felt a hint of amusement.
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "How's the arm?"
Reponse: "Which arm?"
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Well, not the one under the rocks, Soap. Riley's arm." Price's voice took on a careful cadence. "How copy, son?"
Reponse: "Mm," Johnny pushed himself off the wall, and started crawling back to Ghost. His eyes were heavy.
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Roger that." Soap really didn't like disappointing Price, and so he would do his damnedest to stay away from the tempting darkness that was pulling at him. "Arm looks broken."
Reponse: "Open fractures?"
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Do that, Soap. Get the blood flowing to his head."
Reponse: "M' tired, Price."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: A pause. "Is his breathing okay?"
Reponse: "Seems so."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Then leave it on for now."
Reponse: "C'mon Lt., you're missing out on all the fun," he spoke in a forced cheer. "There's like a billion good jokes to be made about our current situation, you're really missing out."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Your head's all red," Simon just kept murmuring, still staring at the sergeant, assessing his injuries. "So are your hands."
Reponse: "Your hands?" came Price's worried voice. Johnny looked down at his fingers, trying to remember why they were covered in crimson.
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "It's a big bruise."
Reponse: "Like hell it is," Ghost hissed when he got a good look at the bloodied clothing scraps. "Fuck, Johnny." There were gloved hands on his shoulders, and he didn't have to imagine the poorly concealed terror in the other man's eyes.
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Like hell it is," Ghost hissed when he got a good look at the bloodied clothing scraps. "Fuck, Johnny." There were gloved hands on his shoulders, and he didn't have to imagine the poorly concealed terror in the other man's eyes.
Reponse: "Told ye, Lt." He was slurring now. "M' not a medic."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Simon." The older man's voice was gentle. "You're not there. Roba is dead. We're getting you out."
Reponse: Between his various soothing sentences, Price said: "Simon, Soap needs you right now."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Done."
Reponse: "Thank Christ. How is he looking?"
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "How's Gaz?" He inquired through gritted teeth, his worry for the young Brit genuine, even if he also asked as a distraction for his mind.
Reponse: "He's-" Ghost could hear the captain swallow. "He's awake, actually."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "I'm going to kill whoever rigged those bombs," Ghost snarled, warming himself on the fire of his anger, desperate for the way it distracted him from the tomb they were stuck in.
Reponse: "Right with you on that one," Price sighed. "Still can't figure out what exactly happened to cause this shitshow."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Must have something to do with Birdman." Ghost unconsciously echoed the nickname Johnny had called the terrorist earlier.
Reponse: "Yeah." The comm went quiet for a few seconds, while Price was talking to either Laswell or Garrick. "I figure the Eagle has a role in this. Laswell thinks the same. We were lucky, though."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Some of us barely."
Reponse: "Still. Had those been stronger explosives, there wouldn't only be partial collapses, the whole system would've gone down."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Sure was. Far from the last time he caused havoc." Price let out another breathy laugh. "Lucky the kid was so skilled in his field, cause his superiors were itching to boot him."
Reponse: "Except for you?"
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Except for you?"
Reponse: "Hm, except me. I always liked his spunk."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "I know." Soap's expression crumbled. "Sorry, Lt."
Reponse: "You know not having a clear head puts the team at risk." Ghost didn't like telling off the man, not in this condition, but there was still that well-known anger burning in his chest, only strengthened by fear. "And it puts  you  at risk." He gestured to the bloodied rags and clothes adorning the sergeant.
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Excuses." Ghost waved his hand dismissively, knowing his eyes gave away his teasing smile. Johnny huffed a weak laugh.
Reponse: "Next time I'll leave ye there, then."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Next time I'll leave ye there, then."
Reponse: "Sure you would, Johnny."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Sure you would, Johnny."
Reponse: "Naw, you're right. Who would patch me up then?"
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Won't be when I get a hold of you, sergeant." The captain said fiercely, echoing Ghost's anger from moments before. Soap gulped nervously.
Reponse: "Ghost already-"
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Ghost already-"
Reponse: "'Bruises', my ass. That's gonna be toilet duty for at least a month."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Make it soon, if you can. Update me when you reach the entrance."
Reponse: "Will do, sir"
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "A man shouted into a cave ' who's in there?  '"Soap was hitting him with his own medicine; terrible jokes as a distraction. Through the sludge of his brain, Ghost decided to humour him. In truth, he was eager for a distraction.
Reponse: "What was the response?"
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Ye alright, Lt.?" Soap slumped against the wall beside him, somehow still standing. His question was soft, without judgment. Ghost internally thanked the man when he didn't push further at the lack of response. Instead the sergeant clicked his comm, updating the man still stuck inside.
Reponse: "Captain, mission success. We're outside."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Sounds amazing," Price mumbled. Ghost was not enjoying the churning worry that had made a home in his body in the last few hours. It only worsened for Price and Gaz now that he and Soap had escaped confinement. "Backup should be arriving in five," Price added.
Reponse: "Hang in there, sir," Ghost said, almost like he would say a command. The captain chuckled in his ear piece.
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Aye. In dim lighting. For ten seconds." Soap's mouth moved into its trademark cheeky grin. "I take it back, Lt."
Reponse: "What's that?"
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "C'mon now, let me see those baby blues," the familiar voice spoke in a sing-song. A firm hand grabbed his jaw.
Reponse: "There you are," said the Eagle with mock sympathy in that American silk voice. "Got worried you'd never wake, sergeant."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Nothing to say?" Graves cocked his head. "Not even a 'hello commander, it's so good to see you. Sorry I blew you up and nearly killed you'?" The fingers digging into Soap's cheeks tightened painfully. "I really believe an apology is in place, Johnny."
Reponse: "You're- You're s'posed t'be dead," Soap rasped, words jumbled due to the grip on his face.
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Oh, yes, I figured the mighty Ghost should be allowed to join us, since you two seem to be joined at the hip." Graves was back next to him, as he gestured to the lieutenant. "Didn't want to take away your safety blanket. Besides, it's always nice to have collateral. It was lucky he took the brunt of that blast," the other man added thoughtfully. "Had he been the one to wake when we arrived, it would have been much harder to detain you two."
Reponse: "Handsome man, isn't he? It's a true mystery why he covers up," Graves continued, clearly enjoying the way his words were riling up his captive. "I think I'm starting to understand your infatuation, MacTavish."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Did you like my trap?" asked the burnt man.
Reponse: "Usually you never shut up, you little shithead," the man sneered, keeping his hand in place for a few seconds before finally removing it. Soap gasped for air, his eyes stinging. "Answer me this time: Did you like my trap,  Johnny ?"
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "I like the mask," Soap forced out with effort. "Covers yer ugly mug."
Reponse: "Don't fall asleep, sergeant." The words were a sick imitation of Price and Ghost's previous concern for him. Soap wished he had let go of his consciousness when Graves' too-big smile swam back into focus. "Good boy," praised the man before him.
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Listen, my good friend," interrupted the American forcefully, standing up straight. "As much as I love our fun banter-" That earned an unimpressed scoff. "I didn't just bring you along for entertainment."
Reponse: "What's yer big plan, Graves?" he asked at last, sadly to his captor's great delight.
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Thought you'd never ask."
Reponse: "Gotta let ye have yer villain monologue."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "You tried to kill me and my team, bastard."
Reponse: "You  blew me up -"
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Oh, you have." The dried blood on Soap's cheeks cracked when his lips stretched into a real smile. "You betrayed the rest of us, and afterwards, after ye almost died for his cause, Shepherd threw ye aside like yesterday's trash."
Reponse: "We had different ideas of what was important," the disgraced commander seethed. "He didn't agree to focus on the 141 first, even when I told him that all we needed was a simple setup including Hassan's remaining allies."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "A big grudge against you especially, then." The man's voice was tight, and Soap was touched by the concern. Where Ghost's face was always that unchanging mask, Simon's was a kaleidoscope of emotions. It was kind of nice to see how deeply the other felt. Soap had always known, but it still brought fondness to his chest.
Reponse: "Aye," he sighed. "He really seems to dislike me. I'm not a great fan of his, either."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Got it," Ghost whispered with a grim smile.
Reponse: "Ghost, play dead." It was impressive how quickly the big man fell back into the position he had been in before he woke up. It was just in time, as Graves sauntered back with purpose, not sparing Ghost a glance.
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Fuckin' hell, Johnny, I thought you were a goner."
Reponse: "You've taken a real shine to me then, Lt.?"
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "How's yer back, Lt.?" Johnny rasped. When the other looked confused, he elaborated: "Ye shielded me from that helicopter blowing up, which, thanks. But how copy?"
Reponse: "Solid. Stings a bit, but nothing serious. I think you should worry about yourself right now, sergeant." Ghost reached over and grabbed a jacket discarded on the backseat. He then pressed it onto the reopened wound, earning a slight hiss from Soap, who allowed his hands to be moved over the fabric. "Keep pressure on that. I'll go check the camp for a med kit and some way of contacting the others. Don't fall asleep. That's an order."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Solid. Stings a bit, but nothing serious. I think you should worry about yourself right now, sergeant." Ghost reached over and grabbed a jacket discarded on the backseat. He then pressed it onto the reopened wound, earning a slight hiss from Soap, who allowed his hands to be moved over the fabric. "Keep pressure on that. I'll go check the camp for a med kit and some way of contacting the others. Don't fall asleep. That's an order."
Reponse: "Aye aye, sir," Soap smiled. "Please make sure the bastard is actually dead?"
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Just an infection. Nothing we can't deal with," Ghost bit out, while he grabbed the disinfectant. "This part is going to fuckin' suck for you, though."
Reponse: "Already does, Lt." Johnny's eyes betrayed his trepidation as he viewed the small bottle.
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "How copy, Johnny?"
Reponse: "Ow." Soap sounded wrecked, but his lips still twitched slightly. "Ye better buy me a fuckin' amazing scotch."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Don't tell the others," Ghost grumbled.
Reponse: "Never. Not if you buy me three drinks."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Yes!" Soap exclaimed, at the same time as Ghost sternly said: "No."
Reponse: "We don't know that for sure," Ghost said evenly. "There were many people around those caves before they exploded, and we have no clue how many could still be around."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Positive," Soap answered immediately, and then watched Ghost expectantly. Simon knew that if he said no, the sergeant would begrudgingly respect his decision.
Reponse: "Affirmative."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "What now?" he asked the lieutenant, who was rubbing a hand over his covered face.
Reponse: "What now ?" Ghost repeated. "Now that we know the area isn't secure, we'll have to tell Laswell and we won't be getting any military backup until tomorrow. Only after that will people be sent in after Price and Gaz."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "What now ?" Ghost repeated. "Now that we know the area isn't secure, we'll have to tell Laswell and we won't be getting any military backup until tomorrow. Only after that will people be sent in after Price and Gaz."
Reponse: "No." Soap squared his shoulders and faced the other.
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "No." Soap squared his shoulders and faced the other.
Reponse: "What the fuck do you mean 'no', Soap?"
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "And both his and Gaz' comms stopped working at the same time?" Ghost stepped very close, towering over the smaller man. "Best we leave and get you some help."
Reponse: "But-"
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Captain." Soap took in the other man's unfocused eyes and worn expression. Even in the dark, it quickly became obvious that the older man was looking real rough, some of the blood stemming from cuts that looked new. "Where is Gaz?"
Reponse: "Inside, he's-" Price flailed slightly, his eyes widening in horror. "There's more of them."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Soap!" The worried voice was one he knew. He dared to open his eyes again.
Reponse: "Price," Soap mumbled.
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "He's breathing. Been out for a long time, but still breathing."
Reponse: "I improvised a tourniquet for Ghost's arm and took his gun, before going after you. My damn leg slowed me down," Price explained, while grabbing fabric from the corpse near them. He then pushed it down on the tear in Soap's body, the sergeant arching slightly.
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Fuck," Price looked down the way he'd arrived and then back to the bleeding man on the ground. " Fuck."
Reponse: "Go," Johnny murmured. "S'okay."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Just makin' ye live up to yer nickname, Lt."
Reponse: "You're living up to yours," Ghost rumbled, finally digging out their last medical supplies. "Keeping up with you is like trying to catch a bar of soap."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Aye, fair. M' point still stands, sir."
Reponse: "Long story," Price echoed.
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "Oxygen, I recon," he explained. "At first everything was shit. You two disappeared and Laswell said the helicopter had been shot down. Then Kyle finally passed out and was completely unresponsive. And I couldn't do any-fucking-thing."
Reponse: "Then everything started to get real funny. Had a good giggle fit. I'm guessing oxygen was sparse. I finally passed out, and woke up here."
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "You're cold?" Price asked. Soap nodded, and promptly felt a little left out when his two friends appeared to have a short, silent conversation above him.
Reponse: "How's the injury, Johnny?" Ghost tacked on.
title: I Woke Up Underground
author: WispScribbles

Dialogue: "He's in capable care, Ghost." Laswell removed her hands when the man finally sank back into his pillows, his mind running into a frenzy. Soap had died. Soap was alive.
